Akutt ankelforstuing etter inversjonstraume. ICPC-2 kode?

L77 — Forstuing ankel

Akutt ankelforstuing kodes med L77 i ICPC-2. Dette er den spesifikke koden for forstuving av ankelen.

Ved ankelforstuing:
- Anvend Ottawa Ankle Rules for å vurdere behov for røntgen
- Gradering: Grad 1 (tøyning), Grad 2 (delvis ruptur), Grad 3 (komplett ruptur)
- Vanligste skade: Laterale ligamenter (ATFL, CFL)

Henvisningskriterier:
- Positiv Ottawa → røntgen for å utelukke fraktur
- Grad 3 forstuing → vurder ortopedisk henvisning
- Manglende bedring etter 6 uker → MR/ultralyd
You are a medical safety advisor for chiropractic. Identify red flags, provide differential diagnosis and clinical reasoning. Always prioritize patient safety.
What warning signs should be monitored for Anterior Canal BPPV: The Rare Variant?

Differential Diagnosis - Critically Important!

 CENTRAL CAUSE MUST ALWAYS BE CONSIDERED: Downbeat nystagmus is a characteristic finding in cerebellar lesions. One study found that 72% of patients with positional downbeat nystagmus had central disorders.

 Peripheral cause: Latency before nystagmus onset, habituation, duration under 60 seconds, response to treatment

 Central cause: No latency, persistent nystagmus, no habituation, lack of response to treatment

Patient asks: "Should I get an X-ray for kyphosis?"

Not necessarily. With typical functional kyphosis without red flags, clinical examination is sufficient. X-ray is relevant if structural cause is suspected, after fracture, or if treatment doesn't produce expected results.

Bilulykker (whiplash)

 Den klassiske årsaken. Ved påkjørsel bakfra utsettes nakken for en rask akselerasjon-deselerasjon som kan skade bløtdelene.

Idrettsskader

 Kontaktidretter som fotball, rugby og kampsport gir økt risiko gjennom direkte slag eller fall.

Fall og ulykker

You are a medical safety advisor for chiropractic. Provide differential diagnosis based on symptoms and clinical findings. Always prioritize patient safety.
Describe diagnosis for Disc Herniation in the Lower Back.

Diagnosis

 Clinical Examination

 A thorough clinical examination is the foundation for diagnosis.

 Straight Leg Raise (Lasegue)

 Sensitivity 92%, specificity 28% (Cochrane, 2010). High sensitivity means the test
 rarely misses a herniation. Positive when pain radiates below the knee with leg elevation between 30-70
 degrees.

 Crossed SLR

 Sensitivity 28%, specificity 90% (Cochrane, 2010). When this is positive, there is
 very high probability of herniation.

 Slump Test

 Sensitivity 84% . Performed sitting and combines neck flexion with knee extension.

 Imaging

 MRI is the gold standard for visualizing disc herniations. But an important point: Studies show that
 30-60% of pain-free people have disc changes visible on MRI. Therefore, it is the symptom
 picture - not the MRI finding alone - that determines the diagnosis.

 When is MRI Appropriate?

 MRI is usually considered after 4-6 weeks if symptoms don't improve with conservative treatment, or
 earlier with worsening neurological deficits.
You are a medical safety advisor for chiropractic. Identify red flags, provide differential diagnosis and clinical reasoning. Always prioritize patient safety.
Identify red flags for Flat Back (Hypokyphosis).

Red Flags - When You Should See a Doctor

 

 
 IMPORTANT: See a doctor FIRST for the following symptoms:

 
 Chest pain - may resemble heart disease and must be investigated

 Palpitations - especially during exertion

 Breathing difficulties - that limit daily activities

 Fainting or near-fainting

 New heart sounds (murmur)

 
 

 
 Remember

 With Straight Back Syndrome, 58-67% have concurrent heart valve problems. Cardiological evaluation is
 recommended before treatment.

Vurder røde flagg: 38 år kvinne. Stikkende smerter fremre brystvegg bilateralt over flere costochondrale overganger. Hevelse palpabel over 2. og 3. ribbe høyre. Ingen systemiske symptomer.

TRYGT: Tietzes syndrom (costochondritt med hevelse). Palpabel hevelse over costochondrale overganger uten systemiske symptomer er patognomonisk for Tietzes syndrom. Godartet tilstand som behandles med NSAID og tålmodighet.

Describe Groups with increased prevalence in the context of Flat Back (Hypokyphosis).

Groups with increased prevalence

 
 Gymnasts and ballet dancers more often develop flat back, probably due to repeated
 extension movements. A study of 33 ballet dancers found hypokyphosis in 9.1% (MDPI, 2021).

 Patients with idiopathic scoliosis often have concurrent reduced kyphosis as part
 of the three-dimensional spinal deformity.

 After spinal surgery: Historically, Harrington rods were known to flatten the back.
 Modern techniques provide better control, but studies still show that 31% of scoliosis surgery
 patients have reduced kyphosis at follow-up (PMC, 2013).

Patient asks: "Can stress trigger attacks?"
No, stress is not a trigger for cluster headache. However, alcohol can trigger attacks within minutes during an active cluster period - but not in the remission phase.

Beskriv Selvhjelp i kontekst av Nakkesleng (Whiplash) og Svimmelhet.

Selvhjelp

 
 Hold deg i bevegelse: Tidlig mobilisering er viktig. Gå turer - armene svinger naturlig og løser opp nakken.

 Unngå statiske stillinger: Ikke sitt med mobilen i fanget i lange perioder, spesielt de første ukene.

 Beveg nakken forsiktig: Beveg nakken innenfor smertefritt område flere ganger daglig.

 Unngå nakkekrage: Studier viser at nakkekrage ikke bare er ineffektiv, men kan hemme bedring. Helsenorge anbefaler mot bruk.

 
 

 Behandlingsforløp

 I akuttfasen (0-2 uker) kan hyppigere behandling våre nyttig, med fokus på tidlig mobilisering. I subakutt fase (2-12 uker) trappes det gjerne ned til 1-2 behandlinger per uke. Forbedring bør sees innen 4 uker; uten bedring bør diagnose og behandling revurderes.

 Når kiropraktikk hjelper - og når det ikke gjør det

 Kiropraktisk behandling er ofte effektiv for mekanisk nakkesvimmelhet - når svimmelheten kommer fordi leddene i nakken ikke beveger seg som de skal, eller når muskelsmerter trigger symptomene.

 
 Kiropraktikk alene er ikke tilstrekkelig hvis:

 
 Du har en aktiv hjernerystelse (trenger hvile/pacing først)

 Du har BPPV/krystallsyke (trenger Epley-manåver, ikke nakkebehandling)

 Du har PPPD (trenger kognitiv tilnærming og gradvis eksponering)

 
 Derfor er en grundig undersøkelse avgjørende får jeg starter behandling.

You are a clinical documentation specialist for chiropractic. Generate accurate, professional patient explanations using correct medical terminology.
Explain Horizontal Canal BPPV to a patient.

Horizontal canal BPPV, also called lateral canal BPPV, is a specific variant of crystal disease where loose ear crystals (otoconia) end up in the horizontal semicircular canal of the inner ear. This canal lies horizontally and registers sideways head movements - it is activated when you shake your head to say "no."

 Traditionally, horizontal canal BPPV has been assumed to account for only 5-30% of all BPPV cases. A large study from 2023 with 3,975 patients found that 46.3% had horizontal canal involvement - almost as common as posterior canal BPPV (47.8%). This difference is likely due to underdiagnosis.

Beskriv Golferen: Når korsryggen tar ståyten for Slik å delegger en stiv rygg for golfsvingen og tennisserven din.

Golferen: Når korsryggen tar ståyten

 

 Golfsvingens kraft kommer fra det forskerne kaller «kinetisk kjede» - en koordinert overfåring av energi fra bakken, gjennom bena, hoftene og trunken, og ut i armene og kølla. En studie av Nesbit og Serrano fra 2005 viste at rygg og hofteledd til sammen star for 68-72% av det totale arbeidet i en golfsving.

 Den moderne golfteknikken er bygget på noe som kalles «X-faktor» - vinkelen mellom skuldre og bekken i toppen av backswingen. Dyktige golfere skaper rundt 30-60 graders separasjon mellom overkropp og underkropp, avhengig av målemetode (Cole og Grimshaw, 2016). Dette «koiler» musklene og lagrer elastisk energi som slippes ut i nedsvingen.

 
 Men hva skjer når brystryggen er stiv?

 Da må lenderyggen kompensere med mer rotasjon enn den er designet for. Og lenderyggen har bare 1-2 grader rotasjonskapasitet per virvel - mot brystryggvirvlenes 4-9 grader.

 

 Resultatet er forutsigbart: Korsryggsmerte er den vanligste skaden blant golfere. Epidemiologiske studier viser at 15-34% av amatØrer og 22-24% av profesjonelle opplever golf-relatert ryggskade (McHardy et al., 2007). Samlet star korsryggproblemer for 18-54% av alle golf-relaterte plager.

 
 3x høyere livstidsrisiko

 Profesjonelle golfere har tre ganger høyere livstidsrisiko for korsryggskade sammenlignet med amatØrer (Kay et al., 2024).

Patient asks: "How do I know if my knee pain is coming from the hip?"

Typical signs include: knee pain that doesn't improve with standard knee treatment, normal MRI images of the knee, visible knee collapse inward during loading, and possibly stiffness or reduced mobility in the hip. A thorough examination of the entire kinetic chain will reveal the connection.

Forklar prognose - kan det bli bedre? for Kronisk daglig hodepine.

Prognose - kan det bli bedre?

 Ja, det finnes høp. Mange med kronisk daglig hodepine opplever betydelig bedring, særlig ved riktig behandlingstilnærming
 26-27% 
 med kronisk migrene reverserer til episodisk 

 75% 
 bedres etter vellykket MOH-seponering 

 Faktorer som bedrer prognosen

 Vellykket seponering av medikamentoverforbruk

 Lavere baseline-frekvens får kronifisering

 Fravar av depresjon og angst

 God søvnkvalitet

 Regelmessig fysisk aktivitet

 Aktiv deltakelse i egen behandling

 Det tar tid

 Bedring skjer ikke over natten. Forvent gradvis bedring over uker til måneder. Det viktigste er konsistens i livsstilsendringer og tålmodighet med prosessen.

Describe how do you know if ear symptoms come from the jaw? for Ear Symptoms from the Jaw: Tinnitus, Ear Pain and Dizziness in TMD.

How Do You Know if Ear Symptoms Come from the Jaw?

 There are several signs that suggest your ear problems may be jaw-related
 Normal otoscopy and hearing test (ENT finds nothing wrong)

 Tinnitus/dizziness changes when you move the jaw

 Symptoms vary day to day, often in step with jaw problems

 Ear pain that worsens with chewing, yawning or talking

 Concurrent jaw symptoms: clicking/grinding in joint, limited opening, pain in chewing muscles

 Headache , especially in the temple

 Teeth clenching or teeth grinding (often unconscious, especially at night)

 When Should You See an ENT Doctor First?

 If uncertain, it makes sense to rule out primary ear pathology with an ENT doctor first. If the examination is normal and you also have jaw symptoms, it points to TMD as the cause - and then a chiropractor is the right next step.

Skriv subjektiv del av SOAP-notat for en pasient med Smerter mellom skulderbladene.

Smerter mellom skulderbladene å det man kaller interskapulær smerte å er en vanlig plage som rammer mange i løpet av livet. Dette er en del av de mange tilstandene som påvirker brystrygg-regionen. Omrødet mellom skulderbladene er et komplekst anatomisk område der mange strukturer kan bidra til ubehag: muskler som trapezius og rhomboideus, facettledd i bryst- og nakkevirvlene, nerver, og til og med indre organer.

 En systematisk gjennomgang fra Briggs og kollegaer (BMC Musculoskeletal Disorders,

Pasient spør: "Betyr dette at smertene mine er «i hodet»?"

Nei. All smerte produseres i hjernen – det gjelder også akutt smerte. At hjernen er involvert betyr at smerten er reell, ikke at den er innbilt. Psykologiske faktorer påvirker opplevelsen – akkurat som søvn, aktivitet og stress gjør. Det er fysiologi.

Kort oppsummert

 5-6,5 år: Kiropraktorutdanningen er et integrert masterprogram med over 300 studiepoeng

 Nytt fra 2024: Bachelor i Biomedisin ved Kristiania i Oslo + master ved SDU i Danmark

 Alternativ: Health Sciences University (HSU) i England eller direkte opptak til SDU

 1 000+ konsultasjoner: Veiledet klinisk praksis er en sentral del av utdanningen

 Autorisasjon: Helsedirektoratet godkjenner utdanning fra ECCE-akkrediterte institusjoner

Ja, 19% får først feildiagnosen migrene . Hovedforskjellen er atferden: migrenepasientene søker ro i mørke rom, mens klasehodepinepasienter vandrer urolig rundt under anfall.

Pasient spør: "Hjelper setevarme mot ryggsmerter i bil?"
Ja, setevarme avslapper muskulaturen og kan redusere muskelspenning i korsryggen. Det er spesielt nyttig på vinterkjøring. Det er imidlertid ikke en erstatning for pauser og strekking.

Gi en kort oppsummering av Akutt Torticollis (Kink i Nakken).

TL;DR - Kort oppsummert

 
 Hva det er: Plutselig, smertefull stiv nakke der hodet blir "løst" til en side - svært vanlig og ufarlig i de fleste tilfeller.

 Vanligste Årsaker: Fasettleddsdysfunksjon ("lasning"), uheldig sovestilling, mindre muskelbelastning. Sjelden alvorlig.

 Kiropraktisk behandling: Moderat evidens for at manuell behandling kombinert med Øvelser kan gi raskere bedring (Cochrane, 2025).

 Røde flagg: Feber + sar hals + hodepine, nevrologiske symptomer, eller traume - da bør du til lege.

 Konsultasjon: 45 min første gang, 30 min oppfølg.

Describe causes and risk factors for Meralgia Paresthetica.

Causes and risk factors

 Common causes

 Tight clothing - pants, belts, corsets, spandex

 Obesity - fatty tissue puts pressure on the nerve

 Pregnancy - growing abdomen and hormonal changes (see also pelvic pain in pregnancy )

 Prolonged standing - increases stretch on the nerve

 Diabetes - makes nerves more vulnerable

 Surgery/trauma - in the pelvic or groin area

 Mechanical causes

 Tool belts - police equipment, carpenter belts

 Car seats - seat belt pressure on long drives

 Sports equipment - cycling shorts, climbing harnesses

 Hip surgery - positioning during surgery

 Medical causes

 Diabetes mellitus - 7 times increased risk

 Ascites - fluid in the abdomen

 Pelvic tumor - rare, but must be ruled out

 Scoliosis or pelvic asymmetry - can also cause SI
 joint problems 

 Note for diabetes

 Diabetics have 7 times increased risk for meralgia paresthetica

 Poor blood sugar control damages nerves in general

 With diabetes and MP - check blood sugar control

Explain common mistakes and re-injury prevention for Return to Sport.

Common mistakes and re-injury prevention

 Six common mistakes when returning to sport

 The most common pitfalls

 1. Pain-free = cleared: Interpreting the absence of pain as a green light without objective testing.

 2. Progressing too fast: Skipping phases or increasing load too quickly, often driven by impatience or pressure from team/coach.

 3. Ignoring psychological readiness: Focusing only on physical goals while overlooking fear, anxiety, and lack of confidence.

 4. Stopping rehabilitation too early: Ending the maintenance programme as soon as return is achieved, instead of continuing preventive training.

 5. Not testing both sides: Only testing the injured side without comparing to the healthy side (or normative data).

 6. One-sided test battery: Using only strength tests without hop tests, or vice versa. A complete assessment requires both plus psychological screening.

 Prevention strategies after return

 Return to sport is not the end of rehabilitation. The first 12 months after return are the high-risk period for re-injury. The following measures reduce the risk
 Maintenance strength programme: Minimum 2 times per week, focusing on hamstrings, quadriceps, and hip muscles

 Neuromuscular training: Balance, perturbation, and reactive exercises 2-3 times per week

 Load management: Gradual increase in training volume and intensity (10-20% increase per week)

 Monitoring: Weekly self-assessment of pain, swelling, and function

 FIFA 11+: A documented effective warm-up protocol that reduces injury risk by up to 30-50%

Describe harmless causes of clicking for Why Does My Shoulder Click? Causes and When to Worry.

Harmless Causes of Clicking

 Most clicking sounds in the shoulder are completely harmless. Here are the most common causes
 Cavitation (gas bubbles)

 Harmless 

 The same process as when you crack your knuckles. Gas bubbles in the synovial fluid are released and
 make a "pop" sound. This doesn't damage the joint and requires no treatment.

 Tendons sliding over bone

 Harmless 

 The shoulder has many tendons that pass over bony prominences. During certain movements, these can
 "snap" or slide over the bone and make a sound. Common and normal.

 Ligament tension

 Harmless 

 Ligaments can suddenly tighten during movement and make a snapping sound. Especially common in people
 with increased joint mobility (hypermobility).

 Muscle tightness

 Harmless 

 Tight muscles around the shoulder can affect how tendons and other structures move, which can lead to
 temporary clicking. Often improves with stretching and activity.

 The Main Message

 Clicking without pain is almost always harmless. The body makes sounds - that's normal. As long as
 you have good function and no pain, there's rarely a reason to worry.

Explain prognosis - can it get better? for Medication Overuse Headache.

Prognosis - Can It Get Better?

 Yes, MOH has a good prognosis with successful discontinuation
 50-75% 
 experience significant improvement 

 6-8 weeks 
 to noticeable improvement 

 30-40% 
 relapse rate in 1st year 

 Factors That Improve Prognosis

 Shorter duration of overuse

 Lower medication use at start

 Absence of combination preparations/opioids

 Good adherence to preventive treatment

 Active lifestyle change

 Risk of Relapse

 30-40% experience relapse in the first year after discontinuation. The risk is highest in the first 6 months. Therefore, follow-up and preventive strategies are important.

 The Underlying Headache

 Remember that discontinuation does not cure the primary headache (migraine/tension headache). The goal is to return to the original state with episodic headache that can be effectively treated with limited medication use. Trigger point treatment can be a useful supplement for managing muscle tension during the discontinuation phase.

Beskriv Bekkenlasning vs. bekkenlossning for SI-leddssmerter og Bekkenlasning.

Bekkenlasning vs. bekkenlossning

 

 Begrepene "bekkenlasning" og "bekkenlossning" beskriver to helt forskjellige tilstander som krever ulik behandlingstilnærming:

 
 Bekkenlasning (hypomobilitet)

 Oppstar når SI-leddet blir for stivt eller "løser seg". Leddet beveger seg ikke som det skal, noe som gir skarp, lokalisert smerte ved bestemte bevegelser og følelse av at bekkenet "henger seg opp".

 

 
 Bekkenlossning (hypermobilitet)

 Oppstar når leddene blir for løse og ustabile. Typisk under graviditet på grunn av hormonet relaxin. Gir diffus, verkende smerte som er vanskelig å lokalisere, og følelse av ustabilitet i bekkenet.

 Fysioterapeut bruker typisk

Beskriv Øvelse 2: Tåspreading for Fottrening som virker: Øvelser for sterkere fåtter.

Øvelse 2: Tåspreading

 

 Etter Ørevis i trange sko har mange mistet evnen til å spre tårne aktivt. Tåspreading reaktiverer abduktØrmusklene og forbedrer stabiliteten i forfoten.

 
 Slik gjør du Tåspreading

 
 Startposisjon: Sitt eller stå med foten flat på gulvet

 Bevegelsen: Spre tårne så langt fra hverandre som mulig

 Fokus: Prøv spesielt å spre stortåen bort fra de andre

 Hold: 5-10 sekunder

 Gjentagelser: 10-15 repetisjoner

 Sett: 2-3 sett per fot

 
 

 
 Tips: Bruk tøseparatØrer

 Hvis du sliter med å spre tårne, kan tøseparatØrer (toe spacers) hjelpe. Bruk dem passivt mens du sitter eller sover for å gradvis gjenvinne tøbevegelighet. Start med 15-30 minutter og Øk gradvis.

Describe the 12 most common types of dizziness for Types of Dizziness: How to Tell the Difference Between Different Forms.

The 12 Most Common Types of Dizziness

 Peripheral Causes (from the balance organ)

 1. BPPV (Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo) - Most Common

 Prevalence: 17-42% of all dizziness cases

 Small calcium crystals detach from their place in the balance organ and end up in the semicircular canals, where they disturb balance registration.

 Brief episodes (10-60 seconds) with head movements

 Triggered by turning in bed, looking up, or bending down

 Symptom-free between episodes

 Treatment: The Epley maneuver has an 80-90% success rate.

 Read more about BPPV → 

 2. Vestibular Migraine

 Prevalence: 1-3% of the population

 Dizziness as part of migraine episodes - can occur with or without headache. The Barany Society calls this "by far the most common cause" of combined neck pain and vestibular symptoms.

 Episodes from minutes to days

 Often light and sound sensitivity

 Migraine history in patient or family

 Read more about vestibular migraine → 

 3. Meniere's Disease

 Prevalence: About 10 times rarer than BPPV

 Chronic condition with increased fluid pressure in the inner ear. Causes classic episodes with four main symptoms.

 Severe vertigo (20 minutes to several hours)

 Fluctuating hearing loss (low-frequency tones first)

 Tinnitus (ear ringing)

 Pressure sensation in the affected ear

 Read more about Meniere's disease → 

 4. Mal de Debarquement (MdDS)

 Persistent rocking or swaying sensation - typically after a boat trip, flight, or car ride. Can last months or years.

 Paradoxically: Better during movement, worse at rest

 Most commonly affects women in their 40s-50s

 Read more about MdDS → 

 5. Cervicogenic Dizziness

 Dizziness related to neck problems. The diagnosis is controversial - the Barany Society refrains from proposing diagnostic criteria due to lack of documentation.

Describe Spinal Infection for Red Flags for Back Pain.

Spinal Infection

 

 Spinal infections include spondylodiscitis and epidural abscess. The incidence has increased
 significantly - from 5.4 to 11.0 per 100,000 between 2005 and 2021.

 
 Risk Factors

 
 Diabetes (18-33%)

 Intravenous drug use (9-19%)

 Immunosuppression

 Recent spinal surgery

 
 

 
 Important to Know

 Fever is only present in about 55% of patients. The absence of fever therefore does not rule out
 infection.

Write a SOAP note for patient with concurrent thoracic pain and costochondritis.

S: 45-year-old female, 3 weeks of anterior chest pain and mid-thoracic pain. Chest pain sharp, worse with deep breathing and trunk rotation. Thoracic pain aching, between shoulder blades. Cardiac workup negative (ECG, troponin normal per GP). Stress at work. No fever, no cough.

O: Thoracic spine: Reduced extension, segmental restriction T4-T6. Paravertebral hypertonicity bilateral. Anterior chest: Tenderness at costochondral junctions 3rd-5th ribs bilateral, left > right. Rib spring test positive T4-T6. Cardiac and respiratory exam: unremarkable.

A: 1) Costochondritis — L04 ICPC-2
   2) Thoracic segmental dysfunction T4-T6 — L04 ICPC-2
   Likely interconnected: thoracic hypomobility contributing to costovertebral and costochondral stress.

P: 1) Thoracic manipulation T4-T6 (supine or prone)
   2) Rib mobilization 3rd-5th ribs
   3) Myofascial release: intercostals, pectoralis minor
   4) Breathing exercises: diaphragmatic breathing 3x/day
   5) Posture correction advice for workstation
   6) Reassurance: cardiac causes excluded

Beskriv årsaker og risikofaktorer for Tarsaltunnelsyndrom.

Årsaker og risikofaktorer

 Biomekaniske faktorer - vanligst

 Plattfot (pes planus) og overpronasjon øker strekket på nerven. Hver gang foten ruller innover, strammes strukturene i tunnelen. Over tid kan dette irritere nerven. Se også tibialis posterior tendinopati og overpronasjon .

 Andre årsaker

 Ganglioncyster: Den vanligste identifiserbare årsaken til tarsaltunnelsyndrom

 Ankelskader: Forstuinger, brudd eller arrvev etter operasjon kan innsnevre tunnelen

 Vaskulære årsaker: Ny forskning fra 2025 viser at åreknuter i tunnelen er en oftere oversett årsak enn tidligere antatt

 Systemsykdommer: Diabetes, lavt stoffskifte og revmatiske lidelser øker risikoen

 Idiopatisk (20-40%): Ingen spesifikk årsak kan identifiseres

Explain prognosis - what to expect? for Pregnant with Back Pain? How a Chiropractor Can Help.

Prognosis - What to Expect?

 Most improve significantly after giving birth. A large Danish study found that 67-75% were
 symptom-free three months after delivery , and over 90% after two years.

 Important to Know

 Prognosis depends on several factors
 Women with pain in all three pelvic joints have a poorer prognosis - about 20% still have
 complaints after two years

 Norwegian guidelines recommend specialized physiotherapy if complaints are not significantly
 better six weeks after delivery

 The risk of getting pelvic pain in the next pregnancy is high - about 85% experience the
 complaints again

 Early treatment and exercises can still significantly reduce severity.

Patient asks: "What's the difference between tennis elbow and golfer's elbow?"

Tennis elbow (lateral epicondylitis) causes pain on the outside of the elbow and affects the extensor muscles. Golfer's elbow (medial epicondylitis) causes pain on the inside and affects the flexor muscles. The treatment principles are similar.

Beskriv Oppsummering for Kiropraktor vs Naprapat: Hva er forskjellen og hvem bor du velge?.

Oppsummering

 

 Kiropraktor og naprapat er begge autoriserte behandlere som kan hjelpe med muskel- og skjelettplager. Hovedforskjellene er:

 
 Rettigheter: Kiropraktorer kan sykmelde, rekvirere bildediagnostikk og henvise til spesialister. Naprapater kan ikke.

 Utdanning: Kiropraktorer har lengre utdanning (5-6 ar vs 4 ar).

 Behandlingstilnarming: Kiropraktorer vektlegger ofte leddbehandling; naprapater vektlegger ofte blotvev og lengre behandlingstid.

 

 
 For de fleste pasienter vil begge yrkesgrupper kunne gi god hjelp. Velg basert pa dine behov - spesielt om du trenger sykemelding eller bildediagnostikk - og finn en behandler du har tillit til.

Beskriv Ofte stilte spørsmål for Spinal Stenose - Tranghet i Ryggen.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Kan jeg bli bedre uten operasjon?

 Ja, de fleste med spinal stenose klarer seg godt uten kirurgi. Langtidsstudier viser at konservativ behandling gir like gode resultater som kirurgi etter 6-8 Ør for de fleste pasienter.

 

 
 Hvorfor blir symptomene bedre når jeg setter meg?

 Når du bøyer ryggen fremover, utvides ryggkanalen og gir mer plass til nervene. Når du strekker deg bakover, blir kanalen trangere. Dette er grunnen til at mange har lettere for å sykle enn å gå.

 

 
 Trenger jeg MR for å få diagnosen?

 Ikke nødvendigvis. Den kliniske undersøkelsen er ofte tilstrekkelig for å stille diagnosen og starte behandling. Husk at MR-funn ofte ikke samsvarer med symptomene.

 

 
 Hvor lenge varer en behandlingsserie?

 Vanligvis anbefales 8-12 behandlinger over 6-12 uker som en første prøveperiode. Deretter vurderes behov for vedlikeholdsbehandling eller egentrening.

 

 
 Kan jeg fortsette å trene med spinal stenose?

 Absolutt! Aktivitet er viktig. Sykling, svømming og vanngymnastikk tolereres ofte godt fordi kroppen er i en fremoverlent posisjon som Åpner ryggkanalen.

Beskriv SI-ledd og bekkensmerter for Korsryggsmerter – Komplett guide.

SI-ledd og bekkensmerter

 

 Gå til full artikkel om SI-ledd ?

 SI-leddet er forbindelsen mellom korsbeinet og bekkenbenet. SI-leddet er smertegenerator hos 15–30% av pasienter med kroniske korsryggsmerter (Cohen et al., 2013).

 
 Hvem får SI-leddsplager?

 
 Etter graviditet og fødsel (svært vanlig)

 Ved asymmetrisk belastning (ett ben kortere)

 Etter traume mot bekkenet

 Ved hypermobilitet

 
 

 Symptomer

 
 Ensidig smerte i nedre del av ryggen, over den ene bakerumpen

 Utstråling til lysken, hoften eller baksiden av læret å men sjelden under kneet

 Verre ved asymmetrisk belastning å stå på ett ben, gå i trapper

 Snudd i sengen provoserer ofte smerten

 

 
 «Bekkenløsningå » hva er det?

 Begrepet beskriver vanligvis nedsatt bevegelighet i SI-leddet, muskelspasmer i bekkenmuskulaturen og asymmetri. SI-leddsplager responderer ofte svært godt på manuell behandling.

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Cervikal Myelopati.

Hva er cervikal myelopati?: Cervikal myelopati betyr at ryggmargen i nakkevirvelsoylen (cervikalkolumna) er under trykk. Ryggmargen er en forlengelse av hjernen som forer nerveimpulser mellom hjernen og resten av kroppen. Nar denne komprimeres i nakken, forstyrres signaloverforingen — med potensielt alvorlige konsekvenser for arm- og beinfunksjon, blare og tarm.

Arsaker: Cervikal myelopati oppstår nar ryggmargskanalen i nakken blir for trang. Flere mekanismer kan bidra, ofte i kombinasjon
Symptomer og kliniske tegn: Cervikal myelopati utvikler seg oftest gradvis og snikende . Mange pasienter tilpasser seg symptomene over tid og soker hjelp forst nar funksjonsnedsetningen er betydelig. Symptombildet avspeiler at ryggmargen — kroppens hovednervelinje — er under trykk.

Rode flagg — Nar er det akutt?: Folgende symptomer ved mistenkt cervikal myelopati krever akutt medisinsk vurdering 
Diagnostikk: En grundig nevrologisk undersokelse er forste steg. Klinikeren tester reflekser, muskelstyrke, folelse, gangmonster og spesifikke myelopatitegn (Hoffmann, Babinski, klonus). Funnene gir mistanke om diagnosen, men bildediagnostikk er nodvendig for bekreftelse.

Behandling — Kirurgi vs. konservativ: Behandlingen av cervikal myelopati avhenger av alvorlighetsgraden. I motsetning til mange andre muskel- og skjelettplager, er kirurgi den eneste behandlingen som kan fjerne selve kompresjonen av ryggmargen .

Kiropraktorens rolle: Ved cervikal myelopati er kiropraktorens viktigste oppgave a gjenkjenne tilstanden og sikre riktig henvisning . Kiropraktorer er spesialutdannet i muskel- og skjelettdiagnostikk og er ofte blant de forste helsepersonell som undersokelser pasienter med nakkerelaterte plager.

Prognose og rehabilitering: Prognosen ved cervikal myelopati avhenger i stor grad av nar behandlingen starter og alvorlighetsgraden ved diagnosetidspunktet .

Provide a structured clinical overview of How a Stiff Back Ruins Your Golf Swing and Tennis Serve.

Key Statistics About Thoracic Spine and Sports: The thoracic spine contributes most of the rotation in the upper body. When this becomes stiff, other
 structures must compensate - often with negative consequences.

The Golfer: When the Lower Back Takes the Hit: The power of the golf swing comes from what researchers call the "kinetic chain" - a coordinated transfer
 of energy from the ground, through the legs, hips, and trunk, and out to the arms and club. A study by
 Nesbit and Serrano from 2005 showed that the back and hip joints together account for 68-72% of
 the total work in a golf swing.

The Tennis Player: The Serve That Reveals the Stiffness: The tennis serve is one of the most demanding movements in sports. Kibler and colleagues established as
 early as 1995 that legs, hips, and trunk together contribute approximately 51% of kinetic energy
 and 54% of total force in a serve. The rest comes from shoulder, arm, and wrist.

The Runner: When Breathing Becomes Limited: Hyperkyphosis - excessive curvature of the thoracic spine - affects not only movement but also breathing
 capacity. Learn more about the connection between breathing, stress,
 and back . The Framingham Study, which followed participants over 16 years, found that women with
 pronounced kyphosis had measurably greater decline in lung function over time compared to those with
 normal posture (Lorbergs et al., 2017).

Why Compensation Leads to Injury: The body is remarkably good at finding detours when the main road is blocked. The problem is that these
 detours often have lower capacity and higher "tolls." With prolonged thoracic pain , the musculature between the shoulder blades can become overloaded.

What Can Be Done?: Treatment of stiff thoracic spine focuses on restoring normal mobility through a combination of manual
 techniques and exercises. A systematic review in BMJ Open Sport & Exercise Medicine (Spencer et al.

Diet and Stress Management

 A study from 2021 showed that over 77% of TMD patients change their diet due to symptoms. Soft diet reduces stress on the jaw joint.

 Avoid
 Chewing gum (main recommendation from all guidelines)

 Tough meat and hard bread

 Raw carrots and nuts

 Large bites requiring wide opening

 Prefer
 Well-cooked vegetables

 Soft fish and ground meat

 Yogurt and smoothies

 Food cut into small pieces

 Stress Management

 Anxiety and stress are among the strongest risk factors for TMD (OPPERA study, 2013). Many tighten the jaw unconsciously when stressed.

 Notice when you clench your teeth - lips closed, teeth apart

 Avoid holding phone between ear and shoulder

 Take breaks during screen work

 Simple breathing techniques can help with relaxation

Brystryggen din skal normalt ha en naturlig kurve bakover, kalt kyfose. Denne kurven fungerer som en biologisk støtdemper når du går og løper, og gir plass til lungene og hjertet i brystkassen.

Describe an overlooked cause of foot problems for Weak Feet: The Root Cause Most People Overlook.

An Overlooked Cause of Foot Problems

 When someone complains about foot pain, flat feet, or poor balance, the usual response is to offer more support: insoles, stability shoes, or orthotics. But this can be like giving crutches to someone with weak legs - it helps in the moment but doesn't address the underlying problem.

 The Vicious Cycle

 Weak feet need support. Support makes feet even weaker. Weaker feet need even more support. The cycle continues - and the feet become increasingly dependent on external help.

 The foot is not a passive foundation that just needs to be held in place. It is an active, dynamic system with over 20 intrinsic muscles , 26 bones, 33 joints, and over 100 ligaments that must work together for optimal function.

 20+ 
 intrinsic foot muscles 

 26 
 bones in the foot 

 33 
 joints in the foot

Patient asks: "What is the mJOA score?"

mJOA (modified Japanese Orthopaedic Association) is a scoring system that classifies the severity of cervical myelopathy. The scale ranges from 0-18, where 18 is normal function. Mild myelopathy is 15-17, moderate is 12-14, and severe is below 12. This score is important for determining whether surgery is necessary.

Forklar prognose: hvor lang tid tar det? for C6.

Prognose: Hvor lang tid tar det?

 Prognosen ved C6-C7 prolaps er generelt svært god. Forskning viser konsistent at det store flertallet blir bra uten kirurgi.

 85-90% 
 betydelig bedring konservativt 

 2-4 uker 
 første merkbar bedring 

 8-12 uker 
 median tid til betydelig bedring 

 Typisk forløp

 Uke 1-2: Akuttfasen

 Smerten er ofte på sitt verste. Nummenhet og eventuell svakhet kan være tydelig. Fokus på smertelindring og å unngåprovoserende aktiviteter.

 Uke 2-6: Subakutt fase

 Gradvis bedring. Smerten avtar, og bevegelsesfriheten øker. Behandling og øvelser gir best effekt i denne fasen.

 Uke 6-12: Rehabiliteringsfasen

 De fleste opplever betydelig bedring. Nummenhet kan vedvare lengre enn smerten. Fokus på å gjenvinne full funksjon og forebygge tilbakefall.

 Diskprolapsen kan krympe

 Et viktig poeng: diskprolapser reabsorberes ofte over tid. Kroppen behandler det utstikkende diskusmaterialet som "fremmedlegeme" og bryter det gradvis ned. Studier viser at større prolapser (sekvestrerte) faktisk har bedre reabsorpsjonsrate enn mindre buklinger.

 Sentripetalt smertemønster

 Et godt prognostisk tegn er at smerten trekker seg "innover" - fra fingre mot skulder og nakke. Dette tyder på at nerveroten blir mindre irritert og prolapsen er på vei tilbake.

Symptoms

 Most experience a gradual onset of symptoms over weeks to months. The pain is typically localized over
 the pubic symphysis at the front center of the pelvis, but can also radiate to the groin, inner thigh,
 lower abdomen or perineum.

 Typical symptoms

 Dull, aching pain over the pubic bone that worsens with activity

 Pain when running, kicking, jumping or changing direction

 Pain climbing stairs

 Discomfort lying on side

 Worsening with coughing, sneezing or straining

 Morning stiffness that loosens with movement

 Waddling gait pattern (antalgic gait)

3. Bekkenkirurgi (sjeldnest)

 Urologiske eller gynekologiske inngrep kan utlose tilstanden. Forekomsten etter urethropexy-operasjon er 0,7-2,5%.

 

 Risikofaktorer

 
 Svak kjerne- og bekkenmuskulatur

 Begrenset hoftebevegelighet

 Rask okning i treningsbelastning

 Tidligere lyskeskader

 Ubalanse mellom adduktor- og abdominalstyrke

 
 

 
 
 
 3
 Symptomer

 

 De fleste opplever en gradvis debut av symptomene over uker til måneder. Smerten er typisk lokalisert over skambensleddet midt foran i bekkenet, men kan også stråle ut til lysken, innerlaret, nedre del av magen eller perineum.

 Typiske symptomer

 
 Dull, verkende smerte over skambeinet som forverres ved aktivitet

 Smerte ved loping, sparking, hopping eller retningsskifte

 Smerter ved å gå opp trapper

 Ubehag ved å ligge på siden

 Forverring ved hosting, nysing eller anstrengelse

 Stivhet om morgenen som løsner ved bevegelse

 Vaggende gangmønster (antalgisk gange)

 
 

 
 
 
 4
 Diagnostikk

 

 Diagnosen stilles primært gjennom sykehistorie og klinisk undersøkelse. Bildediagnostikk brukes for å bekrefte mistanken eller utelukke andre tilstander.

 Klinisk undersøkelse

 
 Pubic spring-test

 Direkte trykk over skambensleddet og sideveis press på skambeinsgreinene. Reproduksjon av kjent smerte regnes som den mest spesifikke testen.

What is the prognosis for Metatarsalgia?

Prognosis and Prevention

 

 With proper treatment, the vast majority with metatarsalgia have a good prognosis. Over 90% improve with
 conservative treatment - similar success rates are seen with plantar
 fasciopathy.

 Expected Course

 
 Mild cases: Improvement within 2-4 weeks with offloading

 Moderate cases: 6-12 weeks with structured treatment

 Long-standing cases: May take 3-6 months, but usually improves

 

 
 Prevention

 
 Proper footwear: Wide toe box, low heel, good cushioning

 Gradual progression: Don't increase activity too quickly

 Maintain weight: Less load per step

 Strengthen feet: Regular exercises for foot muscles

 Variety: Avoid the same loading day after day

1. BPPV/Crystal Disease (17-39% of clinical cases)

 The most common vestibular diagnosis, but far from the only one. Lifetime prevalence in the population is 2.4%, and cumulative risk is approximately 10% by age 80.

 
 Brief dizziness (seconds) with head movements

 Triggered by lying down, turning over in bed, looking up

 Positive Dix-Hallpike test

Hvorfor blir man så sliten?

 

 Når balanseorganet sender feilsignaler, må hjernen jobbe overtid for å kompensere. Denne prosessen - vestibulær kompensasjon - krever betydelige nevrale ressurser.

 
 Tidslinje for kompensasjon

 Ifølge forskning fra 2016 tar det opptil 3 måneder for postural kompensasjon (holdning og støhet), og opptil 1 år for oppfattelse av loddlinjen å normaliseres.

 

 
 Konsekvensen? 75% av pasienter med kronisk krystallsyke var på 50-100% sykefravær i en studie (median sykdomsvarighet over 5 år før adekvat behandling).

Beskriv Problemet med MR-beskrivelser for Slitasje i Nakken - Hva MR-funn Egentlig Betyr.

Problemet med MR-beskrivelser

 

 Måten MR-funn beskrives på, kan skape unødvendig frykt og bekymring. Ord som "degenerasjon", "slitasje" og "artrose" hØres alvorlige ut, men beskriver egentlig normale aldersforandringer.

 
 Nocebo-effekten

 Skremmende MR-beskrivelser kan faktisk gjøre smertene verre. Forskning viser at påsienter som får negative beskrivelser av sine MR-funn, ofte opplever mer smerte, mer frykt for bevegelse, og dårligere prognose enn de som får nøytral informasjon.

 

 Vanlige misforståelser

 
 "Ryggen min er å delagt"

 Fakta: Ryggsåylen er robust og tilpåsningsdyktig. Degenerative forandringer er normalt og betyr ikke at ryggen er "ødelagt".

 

 
 "Jeg må unnga bevegelse"

 Fakta: Bevegelse er medisin for ryggen. Inaktivitet forverrer ofte symptomene, mens tilpåsset aktivitet bedrer dem.

 

 
 "Det kommer bare til å bli verre"

 Fakta: Symptomer kan behandles og bedres selv med slitasje. Mange lever godt med degenerative forandringer i mange tiØr.

Patient asks: "Which exercises should I avoid with GTPS?"

Describe Vestibular Neuritis in the context of Dizzy and Nauseous - Causes, Treatment and When to Seek Help.

Vestibular Neuritis

 Vestibular neuritis is an inflammation of the balance nerve, often following a viral infection. Annual incidence is 3.5-15.5 per 100,000, equivalent to about 500-1000 cases in Norway per year.

 Symptoms come suddenly: severe rotational dizziness, pronounced nausea and vomiting, and difficulty walking. Unlike BPPV, symptoms are constant (not episodic). Most experience significant improvement within 1-3 days, and 50% are symptom-free within 6 weeks.

Hvor lenge varer isjias egentlig?

 

 Det finnes en utbredt oppfatning om at "90% blir friske i løpet av 6 uker." Nyere forskning viser at dette er for optimistisk. Her er hva studiene faktisk viser:

 
 Ved 4 uker

 Omtrent 50% opplever betydelig bedring i symptomer (Koes et al., BMJ 2007). Halvparten har altså fortsatt plager.

 

 
 Ved 6 uker

 Rundt 50% viser klinisk betydningsfull bedring i både smerte og funksjon (StatPearls, 2024). Langt fra "90% friske."

 

 
 Ved 12 uker (3 måneder)

 ATLAS-kohortestudien fra Storbritannia fant at 55% hadde oppnadd minst 30% reduksjon i funksjonshemming. Median tid til bedring er 10-12 uker.

 

 
 Ved 6-12 måneder

 En norsk multisenterstudie fant suksessrater på 49-58% ved 6 måneder. Ved 12 måneder er 55-70% friske.

 

 
 Hva påvirker hvor lang tid det tar?

 Sterkeste prediktor: Pasientens egen tro på at plagene vil bli kroniske. De som tror de vil bli bra, har nesten fire ganger høyere sjanse for å faktisk bli det.

 
 Lang symptomvarighet for behandling

 Hoy smerteintensitet ved start

 Psykosomatiske tilleggsplager

 
 

 Tilbakefall er vanlig

 Selv etter vellykket behandling opplever mange tilbakefall:

 
 24% får tilbakefall innen 4 Ør etter ikke-operativ behandling

 25% av de som var friske ved 2 Ør, hadde fatt tilbakefall ved 4 Ør

 Tilbakevendende ryggsmerter (43%) er vanligere enn tilbakevendende utstraling til bein

 
 Dette understreker viktigheten av forebyggende Øvelser og god ergonomi - også etter at du er bl...

Describe Common Locations for Trigger Points in Hip and Pelvis.

Common Locations

 

 
 Gluteus Medius

 Location: Upper outer buttock

 Referred pain: Low back, outer hip, back of thigh

 Often mimics GTPS or SI joint pain

 

 
 Gluteus Minimus

 Location: Deep under gluteus medius

 Referred pain: Down the side and back of thigh to ankle

 Classic "pseudo-sciatica" pattern - can extend all the way to the foot

 

 
 Piriformis

 Location: Deep buttock, from sacrum to greater trochanter

 Referred pain: Sacroiliac region, buttock, back of thigh

 Related to piriformis syndrome

Beskriv Custom vs. prefabrikerte? for Når innleggssåler faktisk hjelper.

Custom vs. prefabrikerte?

 

 Et vanlig argument for dyre spesialtilpassede ortoser er at de er "bedre" enn billige prefabrikerte. Hva sier forskningen?

 
 
 
 Studie
 Funn
 
 
 
 
 Whittaker et al. (2018)
 Ingen signifikant forskjell mellom custom og prefabrikert
 
 
 Guimarøes et al. (2023)
 Prefabrikerte like effektive som spesialtilpassede
 
 
 CADTH (2022)
 Ikke evidens for at custom-ortoser er bedre
 
 
 

 
 Prisforskjellen

 Spesialtilpassede ortoser kan koste 3.000-8.000 kr, mens prefabrikerte koster 300-800 kr. Til tross for 5-10 ganger høyere pris, viser forskningen ingen forskjell i effekt. For de fleste pasienter er prefabrikerte ortoser like gode.

 

 Unntak: Ved komplekse deformiteter eller spesielle medisinske behov (f.eks. diabetisk nevropati) kan spesialtilpassede ortoser våre nødvendige for optimal trykkavlastning.

Du er en klinisk dokumentasjonsspesialist for kiropraktikk i Norge. Generer nøyaktige, profesjonelle SOAP-notater og klinisk dokumentasjon. Bruk korrekt norsk medisinsk terminologi.
Beskriv Det viktigste undersøkelsesfunnet i kontekst av Kostokondritt og Brystsmerter.

Skarp, stikkende eller verkende smerte langs brystbenet, ofte på én side

 Forverring ved dyp innpust, hosting og nysing

 Økt smerte ved bevegelse av overkroppen eller armene

 Lokal Ømhet som kan gjenskapes ved trykk på bruskforbindelsene

 Utstråling langs ribbeina til ryggen, eller til armer og skuldre

 
 

 Smertene kan variere fra milde til intense. Mange beskriver en følelse av at énoe sitter fastå i brystet. Symptomene kan vare fra noen uker til flere måneder uten behandling.

 

 
 
 
 5
 Diagnostikk

 

 Kostokondritt er en klinisk diagnose - det finnes ingen blodprøve eller bildediagnostikk som bekrefter tilstanden. Diagnosen stilles basert på sykehistorie og fysisk undersøkelse.

 
 Det viktigste undersøkelsesfunnet

 Smerten kan gjenskapes ved å trykke på de affiserte bruskforbindelsene. Dette kalles reproduserbar Ømhet og er karakteristisk for tilstanden.

 

 Når er bilder nødvendig?

 Røntgen og MR er sjelden indisert ved typisk kostokondritt. Bildediagnostikk kan våre aktuelt for å utelukke andre Årsaker ved atypiske symptomer, langvarig forløp, eller mistanke om underliggende sykdom.

 
 Validert klinisk verktøy

 Chest Wall Syndrome Clinical Prediction Rule (Gencer et al., BMC Family Practice, 2012) bruker seks faktorer for å identifisere brystveggsyndrom med 88,6% spesifisitet: lokalisert muskelspenning, stikkende smertekarakter, reproduserbar smerte ved palpasjon, fravar av hoste, smerter som ikke er retrosternale eller trykkende, og ingen kjent koronarsykdom.

 Faktorer som påvirker prognosen

 
 
 
 Positiv
 Negativ

Forklar behandling for Superior Kanal Dehiscens Syndrom.

Behandling

 Konservativ behandling

 For pasienter med milde til moderate symptomer er konservativ behandling ofte førstevalg. Ca. 80% av diagnostiserte pasienter gjennomgår ikke kirurgi. Konservative tiltak inkluderer
 Konservative tiltak

 Unngå utløsende faktorer (høye lyder, pressing, tunge løft)

 Horselvern i stoyende miljøer

 Redusert salt- og koffeininntak

 Acetazolamid (vanndrivende) som viste 78% symptomreduksjon i en studie

 Kirurgisk behandling

 Ved invalidiserende symptomer som vesentlig påvirker livskvalitet, kan kirurgi vurderes. Transmastoid tilgang (TMA) har betydelig lavere revisjonsrate (3,8% vs 33,3%), kortere sykehusopphold og bedre resultater for autofoni (95% vs 80%) sammenlignet med mellomfosså kraniotomi.

 Total kirurgisk suksessrate er 94%. Ved langtidsoppfølg (gjennomsnitt 5,3 år) rapporterte 95% av pasientene bedring.

 Take breaks: If possible, remove the bra for periods throughout the day, especially
 at home.

 posture and reduce strain.

 
 

 Treatment Course

 With bra strap syndrome, the course is often different from other musculoskeletal problems. Many
 experience significant improvement within 1-2 weeks after switching to the right bra. Trigger point pain
 and muscle tension can often be relieved with 3-4 treatments.

 

 
 
 6
 Prognosis

 

 The prognosis for bra strap syndrome is generally good, provided the underlying cause is addressed:

Carotidyni er ensidig smerte i halsen over halspulsaren, ofte med omhet ved trykk. Smerten kan stråle til ansikt, kjeve og øre. Tilstanden er omdiskutert diagnostisk, og alvorlige vaskulære tilstander må utelukkes for diagnosen stilles.

Klinisk vurdering - Pediatrisk nakkesmerte

Sannsynlig diagnose: Akutt torticollis / 'stiv nakke' etter sovstilling

Forventet klinisk bilde:
- Akutt debut, relatert til sovstilling
- Smerte og stivhet, hodet vippet til en side
- Begrenset ROM, spesielt rotasjon
- Muskelspasme SCM, trapezius, paraspinal

Viktig å utelukke hos barn:
1. Atlantoaksial subluksasjon (spesielt etter ØNH-infeksjon)
   - Grisel syndrom: Kan oppstå etter forkjølelse/halsbetennelse
   - Sjekk: Hadde barnet forkjølelse/halsbetennelse nylig?

2. Retropharyngeal abscess
   - Feber, svelgvansker, øm hals

3. Infeksjon (meningitt)
   - Feber, nakkestivhet, allmennsymptomer, lysfølsomhet
   - Sjekk: Kernig, Brudzinski

4. Cervical diskitt
   - Sjelden men alvorlig

Unngå hos barn:
- HVLA cervikal (spesielt øvre cervikal) under 12-14 år
- Aggressiv manipulasjon

Behandling (etter utelukking av røde flagg):
- Forsiktig bløtvevsbehandling
- Mobilisering (lavgrad)
- Varme
- Forsiktig aktiv ROM-øvelser
- Bedring forventet 2-5 dager
- Kontroll hvis ikke bedring 3-5 dager

Henvis ved: Feber, vedvarende symptomer >1 uke, nevrologiske symptomer, nylig infeksjon.

Hva er prognosen for Hodepine i bakhodet?

Prognose

 

 De fleste med hodepine i bakhodet har en god prognose. Spenningshodepine og cervikogen hodepine responderer ofte bra på behandling, særlig når pasientene også gjør egentiltak.

 Realistiske forventninger:

 
 50-70% med cervikogen hodepine opplever klinisk meningsfull bedring ved behandling

 Korttidseffekter er ofte storre enn langtidseffekter

 Tilbakefall er vanlig - vedlikeholdsstrategier er viktige

 Kombinasjon av behandling og egentiltak gir best resultat

 

 Ved kronisk hodepine (over 12 ukers varighet) kan det ta lengre tid å oppna bedring. Tidlig behandling gir ofte raskere bedring - det er ingen grunn til å "vente og se" ved nye hodepineplager.

Skriv SOAP for tenåring med idiopathic skoliose, henvist for vurdering.

S: 14 år jente, idiopatisk skoliose oppdaget ved skolehelseundersøkelse. Adam's test positiv. Ingen smerter. Menarke for 6 mnd siden (Risser sannsynlig 2-3). Mor hadde også skoliose.

O: Holdning: Lett skulderasymmetri, H skulder høyere. Adam's test: Moderat thorakal prominens H (ATR 8°). Bekkenhøyde symmetrisk. Skoliometer: 8° thorakalt. Full ROM alle retninger uten smerte. Nevrologisk: Upåfallende.

A: Adolescent idiopatisk skoliose, thorakal — L85 ICPC-2
   ATR 8° — grensetilfelle for videre utredning. Risiko for progresjon: Moderat (familiehistorie, Risser 2-3, 6 mnd post-menarke).

P: 1) Henvise til helrygg-røntgen stående (AP + lateral) for Cobb-vinkel
   2) Hvis Cobb 20-40°: Vurder Schroth-øvelser eller bracing (SRS guidelines)
   3) Hvis Cobb <20°: Observasjon med kontroll hver 6. mnd til skjelettvekst stopper
   4) Kiropraktisk behandling: Mobilisering og muskelbalaseringsøvelser
   5) IKKE påstå at kiropraktikk kurerer skoliose — evidens viser stabilisering, ikke korreksjon av strukturell kurve
   6) Koordinere med ortoped ved Cobb >40° eller rask progresjon

Beskriv Rocabado 6x6-programmet for KjeveØvelser og Hjemmebehandling for TMD.

Rocabado 6x6-programmet

 

 Dette er den mest dokumenterte ovelsesprotokollen for TMD. Prinsippet er enkelt: 6 Øvelser, 6 repetisjoner, 6 ganger daglig.

 
 Ovelse 1 - Hviletungeposisjon

 Plasser fremre tredjedel av tungen mot ganen med lett trykk. Hold tennene 2-3 mm fra hverandre. "Lips together, teeth apart" er manteret. Denne posisjonen avlaster kjeveleddet.

 

 
 Ovelse 2 - Kontrollert kjeveapning

 Med tungen på ganen, Åpne og lukk kjeven sakte og kontrollert. Bevegelsen skal vare rett opp og ned, uten at kjeven sklir til siden.

 

 
 Ovelse 3 - Hakeinndraging (chin tuck)

 Trekk haken rett bakover, som om du lager en "dobbelhake". Hold i 5-6 sekunder. Dette styrker nakkemuskulaturen og bedrer hodeholding.

 

 
 Ovelse 4 - Nakke-ekstensjon

 Kombiner Øvre nakkefleksjon (nikk ned) med nedre nakkeekstensjon (se opp). Hold i 5-6 sekunder.

 

 
 Ovelse 5 - Skulderholdning

 Trekk skuldrene bakover og ned. Hold i 5-6 sekunder. God skulderholdning påvirker nakken og kjeven.

 

 
 Ovelse 6 - Isometrisk motstand

 Plasser handen mot haken og press forsiktig mens du prøver – Åpne munnen. Kjeven beveger seg ikke - muskelen jobber statisk. Gjenta med motstand mot lukking og sidebevegelser.

You are a medical safety advisor for chiropractic. Provide differential diagnosis based on symptoms and clinical findings. Always prioritize patient safety.
Describe causes and risk factors for Pain Between Shoulder Blades.

Causes and Risk Factors

 The causes of pain between the shoulder blades can be divided from most common to rarest
 Muscular causes (most common)

 Myofascial pain with trigger points

 Myofascial pain with trigger points in the musculature is by far the most common cause of acute pain
 between the shoulder blades. A study in Pain Medicine (2016) found that 93% of patients with chronic
 neck pain had trigger points in the trapezius.

 The muscles between the shoulder blades - especially the rhomboids and middle trapezius - often become
 overloaded from prolonged sitting with forward-leaning posture.

 Referred pain from the neck

 Cervicogenic pain

 French orthopedist Robert Maigne described how up to 70% of "common" pain between the shoulder blades
 actually originates from the lower neck (C5-C7). The facet joints in the neck can refer pain to the area
 along the medial border of the shoulder blade.

 This explains why many experience improvement in shoulder blade pain when the neck is treated. 

 Thoracic facet joints

 Facet joint problems

 Facet joints in the chest contribute to 34-48% of chronic chest pain according to studies with
 diagnostic blocks (Manchikanti, Pain Physician, 2004; 2020). These small joints between the vertebrae
 can become irritated or worn, especially with repetitive movements or prolonged poor posture. In more
 severe cases, it may involve thoracic disc herniation .

 Dreyfuss and colleagues (Spine, 1994) mapped how these joints typically produce pain one segment down
 and slightly to the side.

 Posture-related problems

 Upper crossed syndrome

 Vladimir Janda described in the 1980s what he called "upper crossed syndrome": an imbalance where
 anterior muscles (chest, neck) become tight while posterior muscles (rhomboids, middle trapezius) become
 weak and stretched. This pattern can be reinforced by rounded back
 (hyperkyphosis) or conversely by flat back (hypokyphosis) .

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Athletic Pubalgia (Sports Hernia).

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Can I continue training with athletic pubalgia?

 It is not recommended to train through the pain. Continued activity worsens the
 condition and prolongs rehabilitation time. A modified training plan that avoids triggering movements
 (kicking, rapid turns) is necessary at first.

 

 
 What is the difference between athletic pubalgia and a regular groin strain?
 

 Groin strain (adductor strain) affects the muscle tissue and usually resolves
 within 3-4 weeks. Athletic pubalgia involves the tendon-bone attachment at the pubic bone and has a more
 prolonged course. Adductor strain accounts for 62% of groin injuries in soccer.

 

 
 Do I need an MRI to get a diagnosis?

 Not necessarily. Clinical examination is often sufficient to make the diagnosis.
 MRI is useful to confirm suspicion, rule out other causes, and plan any surgery - but changes on MRI are
 also found in asymptomatic athletes.

 

 
 How long does it take to recover?

 With structured conservative treatment: 9-18.5 weeks to return to sport. After
 surgery: 6-12 weeks. The time depends on the severity of the injury and how quickly proper treatment
 begins.

 

 
 Can a chiropractor help, or do I need to go straight to a surgeon?

 Conservative treatment with structured exercise is the first choice and succeeds
 in 50-70% of patients. A chiropractor can help with examination, guidance, and manual treatment. Surgery
 is appropriate only after 2-6 months without sufficient improvem...

Identify red flags for Pain Between Shoulder Blades.

Red Flags - When to See a Doctor

 

 
 Seek medical help immediately for the following symptoms:

 
 Sudden, intense "tearing" or "cutting" pain - may indicate aortic dissection, an
 acute life-threatening condition

 Chest pain, breathing difficulties, cold sweats - especially in women, heart
 attacks often present with back pain rather than classic chest pain

 Unexplained weight loss, fever or night sweats

 Pain that wakes you at night and does not improve with position change

 Previous cancer history

How is Tension Headache: Everything You Need to Know diagnosed?

How is the Diagnosis Made?

 

 Tension headache is diagnosed primarily through medical history and clinical examination. There is no blood test or imaging that confirms the diagnosis.

 Clinical examination includes:

 
 Systematic palpation of neck and head muscles to identify trigger points and tenderness

 Assessment of neck mobility

 Neurological examination to rule out other causes

 Mapping of headache character, frequency, and triggering factors

 

 
 Do I need an MRI?

 Imaging is rarely necessary. MRI or CT is only ordered when underlying disease is suspected - for example with red flags or atypical presentation. It's important to know that findings such as degenerative changes on MRI are very common even in pain-free individuals, and often do not explain the headache.

Provide a structured clinical overview of Cervical Disc Herniation and Pinched Nerve in the Neck.

What is disc herniation and cervical radiculopathy?: Cervical radiculopathy means a nerve root in the neck is irritated or compressed. This
 causes symptoms radiating to the shoulder, arm or hand - often called "nerve root involvement,"
 "brachialgia" or colloquially: "pinched nerve in the neck."

Causes and risk factors: Interestingly, only 14.8% had physical exertion or trauma just before symptom onset in the Rochester
 study. Most cases develop gradually without a specific triggering event.

Which nerves are affected - and what characterizes each?: The neck has seven cervical vertebrae, and the nerves exiting between them are named after the vertebra
 above. Note: Only 62.6% of patients have standard dermatome patterns, and 67.3% show typical myotome
 patterns (Neurospine 2022). About one-third have atypical symptoms.

Carpal tunnel or neck? How to tell the difference: Numbness in the hand can come from the neck (cervical radiculopathy) or from the wrist (carpal tunnel
 syndrome). Symptoms can be similar, but there are important differences. One study showed that 62.2% of
 patients with cervical radiculopathy also have carpal tunnel syndrome - so-called "double crush
 syndrome."

Diagnosis: A thorough clinical examination is often more important than imaging. The chiropractor assesses neck
 mobility, muscle strength, sensation and reflexes.

Treatment: This is the key message: 75-90% of patients with cervical disc herniation and
 radiculopathy improve significantly without surgery. Danish national guidelines from 2017 recommend
 manual treatment combined with exercises as first choice, before medication is considered.

Red flags - when you should see a doctor: These signs may indicate cervical myelopathy (spinal cord involvement) or
 other serious conditions requiring prompt evaluation.

Prognosis: The prognosis for cervical radiculopathy is generally good. Most improve significantly with
 conservative treatment, and only a minority need surgery.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Sciatica, Disc Herniation or Lumbago?.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Can I have a disc herniation without knowing it?

 Yes, absolutely. Studies show that 30-50% of healthy, pain-free people have visible disc changes on MRI. Disc herniation is only a problem when it causes symptoms.

 

 
 Do I need surgery if I have a disc herniation?

 No, most people don't need surgery. Conservative treatment gives equally good long-term results for most. Surgery is considered for cauda equina syndrome, progressive paralysis, or persistent severe symptoms despite treatment.

 

 
 How long does lumbago last?

 Most people experience significant improvement within 2-6 weeks. Some have mild residual symptoms longer. Pain lasting over 12 weeks is considered chronic back pain.

 

 
 Is it dangerous to see a chiropractor for sciatica?

 No, chiropractors are trained to assess and treat sciatica. If a serious underlying cause is suspected, you will be referred. Early treatment can actually contribute to faster recovery.

 

 
 Can stress cause back pain?

 Yes. Psychosocial factors such as stress, anxiety and depression are strong predictors of chronic back pain. Body and mind are connected - muscle tension and altered pain perception during stress are real phenomena.

 

 
 What's the difference between a chiropractor and physiotherapist for back problems?

 Both professions treat back problems. Chiropractors have particular expertise in joint manipulation and diagnosis of musculoskeletal conditions, and have primary contact s...

Explain treatment: exercises and rehabilitation for Shoulder Impingement.

Treatment: Exercises and rehabilitation

 Exercises are the cornerstone of shoulder impingement treatment. A Cochrane review by Page et al. (2016) shows moderate quality evidence that exercise therapy reduces pain and improves function. Systematic reviews also show that exercises combined with manual therapy are as effective as surgery after 1 year (Haik et al. 2016; Kuhn 2009).

 60-70% 
 improve with exercises within 3-6 months 

 As good 
 as surgery after 1 year 

 Phase 1: Pain relief and load management (0-4 weeks)

 Avoid activities that provoke severe pain

 Isometric exercises for the rotator cuff (tension without movement)

 Postural correction and ergonomic adjustments

 Gentle mobilization of the thoracic spine and shoulder blade

 Phase 2: Gradual progressive training (4-12 weeks)

 Eccentric strengthening for the rotator cuff

 Scapular stabilization exercises (serratus anterior, lower trapezius)

 Gradually increasing range of motion

 Load progression based on pain response

 Phase 3: Full rehabilitation (12+ weeks)

 Sport- or occupation-specific training

 Overhead exercises and heavy loading

 Preventive maintenance exercises

 Gradual return to full activity

 Key principles for exercises

 Mild pain during exercises (up to 3-4 out of 10 on a pain scale) is acceptable and may even be beneficial. Pain should not persist beyond 24 hours after training. If it does, reduce the load somewhat.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Nociplastic Pain: When the Nervous System Becomes Oversensitive.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 What is nociplastic pain?

 Nociplastic pain is pain that arises from altered pain processing in the nervous system, without clear tissue damage or nerve involvement. The nervous system has become oversensitive and amplifies pain signals.

 

 
 Is nociplastic pain real pain?

 Yes, absolutely. The pain is just as real as any other pain. The difference is that the cause lies in the nervous system's processing of signals, not in detectable tissue damage. Modern brain imaging shows that the pain activates the same brain regions as other types of pain.

 

 
 Can nociplastic pain be treated?

 Yes, but it requires a different approach than traditional pain treatment. Treatment focuses on "reprogramming" the nervous system through graded activity, pain education, stress management, and cognitive therapy.

 

 
 How do I know if I have nociplastic pain?

 Typical signs include pain that doesn't match examination findings, widespread pain across multiple areas, hypersensitivity to touch and other stimuli, and pain that doesn't respond to conventional treatment. A thorough clinical evaluation is necessary.

 

 
 Is central sensitization the same as fibromyalgia?

 Fibromyalgia is considered a form of nociplastic pain with central sensitization. However, central sensitization can occur in many conditions, including chronic back pain, migraine, and irritable bowel syndrome.

 

 
 Can a chiropractor help with nociplastic pain?

 Yes, a chiropractor ...

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for C5-C6 Disc Herniation: Thumb and Index Finger Numbness.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 What is the difference between C5-C6 disc herniation and carpal tunnel
 syndrome?

 With carpal tunnel syndrome, symptoms are often worst at night and improve when
 you shake your hand. Numbness affects the thumb, index finger, middle finger, and half of the ring
 finger. With C5-C6 disc herniation, symptoms worsen with neck movements, and only the thumb and index
 finger are affected. The biceps may also be weak.

 

 
 Do I need an MRI for C5-C6 disc herniation?

 Not routinely. MRI is only indicated for serious neurological deficits,
 suspected serious underlying pathology, or if you haven't improved after 6-8 weeks of conservative
 treatment. Many normal age-related changes appear on MRI without explaining the symptoms.

 

 
 How long does it take for C5-C6 disc herniation to heal?

 About 85% experience significant improvement within 8-12 weeks with conservative
 treatment. Most notice progress within 2-4 weeks. Full recovery can take up to 6 months, and the
 herniation can shrink and be reabsorbed over time.

 

 
 Can I exercise with C5-C6 disc herniation?

 Yes, adapted activity is important. Avoid extreme neck extension and heavy
 overhead lifting during the acute phase. Light neck mobility exercises, isometric exercises, and
 general low-intensity training are recommended. A chiropractor can guide you with specific exercises.
 

 

 
 When should I contact a doctor immediately?

Describe What Does the Research Say? for Do You Really Need Orthotics?.

What Does the Research Say?

 

 Meta-analyses: Orthotics vs. placebo

 The most comprehensive systematic review (Whittaker et al. 2018, British Journal of Sports Medicine) analyzed 19 studies with 1660 participants with heel pain/plantar fasciitis:

 
 
 
 Timepoint
 Finding
 
 
 
 
 Short-term (0-6 weeks)
 "Very low quality evidence that foot orthotics DO NOT reduce pain"
 
 
 Medium-term (7-12 weeks)
 Only small effect compared to sham insoles (SMD = -0.27)
 
 
 Long-term (13-52 weeks)
 No significant difference from placebo
 
 
 Custom vs. prefabricated
 No difference at any timepoint - despite enormous price difference
 
 
 

 
 APTA Guidelines 2023

 American Physical Therapy Association updated their guidelines in 2023 to Grade C recommendation: "Clinicians should NOT use orthotics as isolated treatment for short-term pain relief in plantar fasciitis."

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Headache After Whiplash - Post-Traumatic Headache.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 How long does headache after whiplash last?

 In most people (50-80%), the headache resolves within 3 months. Around 20-50% develop chronic symptoms
 that last longer. Early active treatment reduces the risk of chronicity.

 Should I use a neck collar?

 No, in most cases. Norwegian health authorities recommend that collar not be used, or maximum 48 hours
 for grade II-III. Research shows that collar can prolong symptoms.

 Can a chiropractor help with headache after whiplash?

 Yes, manual treatment has moderate evidence for improving headache and neck pain in the short term,
 especially combined with exercises. Early treatment gives better results than waiting.

 When should I get an MRI of my neck?

 MRI is rarely necessary for uncomplicated whiplash. Imaging is only indicated with neurological
 deficits or suspicion of serious injury. Clinical examination is often more informative.

 Can I exercise after whiplash?

 Yes, and you should start early. Norwegian health authorities recommend starting within 4 days. Begin
 with gentle movements and increase gradually. Avoid contact sports and heavy lifting in the acute phase.
 

 What's the difference between migraine and headache from the neck?

 Cervicogenic headache starts in the neck and worsens with neck
 strain. Migraine is often pulsating, unilateral and accompanied by nausea/light sensitivity. In
 post-traumatic headache, we often see a mix. Read more about occipital neuralgia for inform...

Describe the two types of bruxism for Teeth Grinding.

The Two Types of Bruxism

 Sleep Bruxism

 This is the classic "nighttime teeth grinding" most people think of
 Rhythmic movements: The jaw moves in repetitive patterns

 Occurs in light sleep: Especially in transitions between sleep stages

 Enormous forces: Can generate 50-80 kg pressure - far above normal chewing force of 10-15 kg

 Sound: Partner often hears loud grinding noise

 Morning symptoms: Headache, sore jaw, tired chewing muscles

 Important: Sleep bruxism is classified as a sleep-related movement disorder and is often linked to other sleep problems.

 Awake Bruxism

 This type occurs while you're awake and is fundamentally different
 Static clenching: You press teeth together without movement

 Stress trigger: Triggered by concentration, stress , frustration

 Semi-conscious: You can learn to become aware of it

 Daytime symptoms: Jaw pain that increases throughout the day

 More common in women: Studies show higher prevalence

 Why the Distinction Matters

 Awake bruxism can be treated with awareness training and biofeedback - you can learn to stop. Sleep bruxism happens unconsciously and requires other approaches like sleep hygiene, stress management and protective measures.

Explain Scheuermann's Disease to a patient.

Scheuermann's disease is a growth disorder of the spine that occurs during puberty.
 During the growth spurt, several vertebrae develop unevenly - the front part grows
 slower than the back part. The result is wedge-shaped vertebrae that create a permanent,
 increased curvature in the thoracic spine .

 The condition was first described by Danish orthopedist Holger Werfel Scheuermann in
 1920. His Danish colleague Kaj Sorensen established the diagnostic criteria in 1964,
 which are still used internationally today.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Calcific Tendinitis: Everything You Need to Know.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Can calcific tendinitis go away on its own?

 Yes. Calcific tendinitis is a self-limiting condition. The calcium will eventually be reabsorbed
 naturally, but this can take anywhere from a few months to several years. Treatment can speed up the
 process and relieve symptoms in the meantime.

 

 
 Does shockwave therapy (ESWT) help with calcific tendinitis?

 ESWT has Level I evidence for calcific tendinitis. The KALK study (BMJ 2023) showed no difference
 from placebo for patients with shorter symptom duration. The treatment appears to be most useful for
 patients with long-term symptoms.

 

 
 Do I need surgery for calcific tendinitis?

 Rarely. 80-99% of patients recover without surgery. Surgery is only considered for long-term symptoms
 (over 6-12 months) after failed conservative treatment.

 

 
 Why does the pain suddenly go from bad to very bad?

 This happens in the resorptive phase when the body breaks down the calcium. The immune system
 activates, inflammation occurs, and this causes intense pain. Paradoxically, this is often a sign that
 the body is resolving the problem.

 

 
 Can calcific tendinitis come back?

 The recurrence rate is low once the calcium is fully reabsorbed. However, in rare cases, calcific
 tendinitis can occur in the other shoulder.

 

 
 Should I avoid all activity?

 No. In the acute phase, you should avoid movements that provoke pain, but complete rest is not
 recommended. Adapted activity within pain...

Describe causes and risk factors for Headache in Back of Head.

Causes and Risk Factors

 Tension Headache

 Most Common - 26-38% 

 Tension headache is by far the most common type of headache. The pain is typically described as a band around the head that extends into the back of the head.

 A study found that all patients with chronic tension headache had trigger points in the suboccipital muscles - 65% were active and 35% latent.

 Risk factors: Sedentary work, stress, poor sleep, forward head posture during screen work.

 Migraine

 14% of population 

 Migraine affects approximately 14.4% of the global population. Although migraine is often associated with pain in the temple or forehead, the pain starts in the back of the head in about 18% of patients.

 Typical signs: Unilateral, pulsating pain, nausea, light and sound sensitivity, worsening with physical activity.

 Cervicogenic Headache (from the neck)

 2.5-4% of population 

 Cervicogenic headache has a special place in Norwegian medical history. The Norwegian neurologist Ottar Sjaastad was among the first to systematically describe the condition.

 Characteristics: The headache always starts in the neck and radiates forward toward the eye or forehead. The pain stays on one side (never switches sides). Neck mobility is often reduced.

 Occipital Neuralgia

 Rare 

 Occipital neuralgia is relatively rare, with an incidence of only 3.2 per 100,000 people. The condition is characterized by sharp, electric shock-like pain in the back of the head along the occipital nerve.

 Typical: Intense, shooting pains lasting from seconds to minutes, tenderness over the occipital nerve behind the ear.

 TMJ Disorders (TMD)

 Problems in the jaw joint can cause referred pain to the back of the head. Many patients with TMD also have neck problems and tension headache.

 Temporal Arteritis - Red Flag in People Over 50

 Temporal arteritis is an inflammatory condition of blood vessels that requires urgent evaluation.

Differensialdiagnoser ved Nakkesmerter i Svangerskapet?

Hormonelle endringer (rammer alle gravide)

 Under svangerskapet produserer kroppen hormonet relaxin , som løsner opp leddbånd og bindevev for å forberede kroppen på fødsel. Relaxin-nivåene er høyest i første trimester, men hormonet blir værende i kroppen gjennom hele svangerskapet og flere måneder etter fødsel.

Holdningsendringer og tyngdepunktsforskyvning

 Etter hvert som magen vokser, forskyves kroppens tyngdepunkt fremover. For å kompensere lener mange gravide seg bakover, noe som fører til økt svai i korsryggen. Denne holdningsendringen forplanter seg oppover i ryggsøylen og påvirker nakken.

Vektøkning og brystforstørrelse

 Den naturlige vektøkningen i svangerskapet - typisk 10-16 kilo - legger ekstra press på alle vektbærende ledd. Brystene kan øke betraktelig i størrelse, noe som trekker skuldrene fremover og skaper spenninger i øvre rygg og nakke.

Søvnforstyrrelser

 God søvn blir vanskeligere utover i svangerskapet. Mange gravide sliter med å finne en komfortabel sovestilling, må opp flere ganger om natten, og har generelt urolig søvn. Dårlige soveposisjoner kan føre til stiv og smertefull nakke om morgenen.

Describe Conditions Where Evidence Is Weak for When Orthotics Actually Help.

Conditions Where Evidence Is Weak

 

 For the following conditions, evidence is weak or absent - despite orthotics being frequently prescribed:

 
 "Overpronation"

 Nielsen et al. (2013) randomized 927 novice runners to shoes based on foot type versus neutral shoes. Result: No difference in injury rates. Overpronation as a diagnosis lacks scientific basis.

 Read more about the overpronation myth

 

 
 Flexible Flat Foot Without Symptoms

 Choosing Wisely (2023): "Avoid treatment of the normal variant asymptomatic flexible flat foot." Up to 26% of adults have flat feet - most without complaints. Treatment is unnecessary and potentially harmful.

 

 
 Nonspecific Foot and Heel Pain

 Whittaker et al. (2018) meta-analysis: Orthotics are no better than placebo in the long term. APTA (2023) does NOT recommend orthotics as isolated treatment for plantar fasciitis.

 

 
 Knee, Hip or Back Pain

 72-93% of podiatrists prescribe orthotics for these conditions - despite no evidence for effect. This represents significant overtreatment.

Forklar behandling — trening vs. kirurgi for Rotator Cuff — Komplett Guide til Rotatorkuffen.

Behandling — trening vs. kirurgi

 Forskningen pa rotator cuff-behandling har endret seg dramatisk de siste 10-15 arene. Norge har vart i frontlinjen av denne utviklingen. 

 Trening som forstevalg

 For degenerative (atraumatiske) rotator cuff-skader — som utgjor det store flertallet — er strukturert trening forstevalg. Flere hoykvaltietsstudier stotter dette
 Norsk forskning: Moosmayer et al.

 Stefan Moosmayer og kolleger ved Oslo og Lovisenberg gjennomforte en randomisert kontrollert studie som sammenlignet trening med kirurgi for sma og mellomstore rotator cuff-rupturer. Resultatene etter 1 ar viste ingen signifikant forskjell mellom gruppene (Kukkonen et al., 2015, Bone Joint J).

 Enda mer imponerende: ved 10 ars oppfolging (Moosmayer et al., 2019) var det fortsatt ingen klinisk betydningsfull forskjell. Treningsgruppen klarte seg like bra som kirurgigruppen pa lang sikt.

 OPTIROT-studien (pagaende)

 OPTIROT er en stor norsk randomisert studie som sammenligner trening med kirurgi for sma og mellomstore rupturer. Studien ledes fra Oslo og Lovisenberg og er en av de viktigste pagaende studiene pa feltet internasjonalt.

 Re-tear etter kirurgi: 20-40%

 Et viktig poeng som ofte underkommuniseres: 20-40% av opererte rotator cuff-rupturer ryker igjen (Carr et al., 2015, Lancet). For store og massive rupturer er re-tear-raten enda hoyere. Interessant nok har mange pasienter god funksjon til tross for re-ruptur — noe som reiser sporsmalet om det er selve rehabiliteringen, snarere enn senetilhelingen, som gir resultater.

Describe treatment options for Pain Behind the Shoulder.

Treatment

 

 
 Conservative treatment (first choice)

 
 Sleeper stretch: Documented effective for GIRD. Improves internal rotation by
 approximately 10 degrees.

 Cross-body stretch: Stretches the posterior capsule

 Rotator cuff strengthening: Especially external rotators and scapula stabilizers
 

 Scapula control: Improve shoulder blade movement - good ergonomics is also important

 Throwing mechanics: Optimize technique to reduce load

 
 

 
 What can a chiropractor do?

 
 Manual treatment: Mobilization of shoulder and thoracic spine

 Soft tissue treatment: Work on infraspinatus, teres minor, posterior capsule -
 see also cortisone injection if needed

 Exercise guidance: Sleeper stretch, strengthening exercises

 Activity modification: Adapt training during rehabilitation

 
 

 
 Sleeper stretch - proper execution

 
 Lie on the affected side with shoulder at 90 degrees abduction

 Use the opposite hand to press the forearm down toward the floor

 Hold 30 seconds, 3-5 repetitions

 Important: Don't let the shoulder lift from the surface

Explain Disc Herniation in the Lower Back to a patient.

The intervertebral discs function as shock absorbers between the vertebrae. Each disc has a hard outer
 ring (annulus fibrosus) and a soft, gel-like core (nucleus pulposus). A herniation occurs when this core
 is pushed through cracks in the outer ring and can irritate or compress nerve roots.

 Disc problems are nevertheless a rare cause of back pain . The WFNS Spine Committee
 (2024) states that degenerative disc disease accounts for less than 5% of all lower back pain cases.
 Most back pain is due to muscular and non-specific causes (80-90%).
