Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Sever's Disease.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Does my child have to stop training with Sever's disease?

 Not necessarily. Activity should be adapted to the pain level. The child can often
 continue training with reduced intensity and volume. Pain-free activities like swimming and cycling are
 good alternatives during periods with significant symptoms. Complete rest is rarely recommended.

 

 
 How long does Sever's disease last?

 The condition is self-limiting and resolves when the growth plate closes, usually
 around 12-14 years for girls and 14-16 years for boys. Symptoms can last from a few months to 2 years,
 depending on activity level and treatment. Many have periods of improvement and worsening.

 

 
 Is Sever's disease dangerous?

 No, Sever's disease is not dangerous and causes no permanent damage. It is a
 common, benign condition caused by growth-related pain. The condition always resolves on its own when
 the child finishes the growth spurt, and there is no risk of long-term problems.

 

 
 Do heel insoles help with Sever's disease?

 Yes, heel cups or cushioning insoles can help by reducing the load on the growth
 plate. They should be used in both sports shoes and everyday shoes. Prefabricated insoles from the
 pharmacy or sports store often work as well as custom-made ones.

 

 
 Can Sever's disease come back?

 Yes, symptoms can return with increased activity or a new growth spurt. This is
 normal and does not mean the condition has worsened. When the growth plate ...

Explain prognosis: how long does it take? for C5.

Prognosis: How Long Does It Take?

 The prognosis for C5-C6 disc herniation is generally good. Research shows that the vast majority
 recover with conservative treatment, without the need for surgery (Caridi et al., 2011; Radhakrishnan et al., 1994).

 85% 
 significant improvement without surgery 

 2-4 
 weeks to first noticeable improvement 

 8-12 
 weeks median time to significant improvement 

 What Affects Prognosis?

 Good Prognostic Factors

 Early treatment initiation

 Younger age (under 50)

 Predominantly radicular pain (arm pain dominates)

 No serious neurological deficits

 Good daily function despite pain

 Factors That May Prolong Recovery

 Delayed treatment initiation

 Concurrent depression or anxiety

 Catastrophic thinking about the pain

 Passive coping strategies (avoidance, bed rest)

 Prolonged neck stiffness before symptom onset

 Can the Herniation Shrink?

 Yes. Disc herniations can actually be reabsorbed over time. The body has a remarkable ability to break
 down and remove the protruding disc material. Inflammation around the nerve gradually decreases, and
 symptoms often improve before the herniation itself is completely gone.

 Studies show that larger herniations (sequestered) actually have better reabsorption rates than smaller
 bulges, because the immune system more easily "discovers" and breaks down the loose disc material.

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Rygg, Hofte eller Isjias?.

1 Hvorfor er dette så vanskelig?: Rygg, hofte og isjias deler overlappende symptomer og smertemønstre. Smerte i benet
 kan komme fra hofteleddet, fra ryggen via nervene, eller fra begge steder samtidig.
 Forskning viser at nesten halvparten av alle pasienter med hofteproblem først får
 en feil diagnose å ofte behandles de for ryggproblemer som de ikke har.

3 Hvor kjennes smerten?: Lokalisasjonen av smerten gir viktige ledetrøder, men er ikke alltid pålitelig. Her er typiske mønstre
4 Hva forverrer smerten?: Provokasjonstester og funksjonelle bevegelser kan hjelpe å skille mellom de ulike årsakene
5 Hip-Spine Syndrome: Opp til 30% av pasienter med hofteartrose har samtidig signifikant
 ryggsykdom. Dette kalles "hip-spine syndrome" og kompliserer både diagnostikk
 og behandling.

6 Isjias vs. Piriformis Syndrom: Begge gir smerte nedover benet, men årsakene er forskjellige
8 Behandlingstilnærming: Behandlingen avhenger helt av riktig diagnose. Dette er hvorfor en grundig undersøkelse er så viktig
Usikker på om det er ryggen, hoften eller begge?: En grundig undersøkelse gir svar.

What warning signs should be monitored for Acute Back Pain?

SEEK MEDICAL ATTENTION IMMEDIATELY FOR
 Cauda equina symptoms: Problems with urination or bowel function combined with
 numbness in the genital/buttock region

 Progressive weakness: Increasing weakness in the legs

 Fever and back pain: The combination may indicate infection

 Unexplained weight loss: Combined with back pain

 Night pain: Pain that wakes you at night unrelated to movement

 Previous cancer history: Back pain in a person with known cancer

 Recent trauma: Especially with osteoporosis risk

Beskriv Hva kan du gjøre selv? for Krum Rygg og Dårlig Holdning.

Hva kan du gjøre selv?

 

 Egeninnsats er avgjørende for varig forbedring. Her er tre Øvelser med dokumentert effekt:

 
 1. Thorakal ekstensjon på rulle

 Yoo (2018) dokumenterte 5,8 grader reduksjon i kyfosevinkel over bare 12 dager med denne Øvelsen.

 
 Legg deg på ryggen med en foam roller på tvers under Øvre rygg. Stått hodet med hendene og len deg forsiktig bakover over rullen. Hold i 5-10 sekunder, gjenta 5-10 ganger. Flytt rullen litt opp eller ned for å treffe ulike nivåer.
 

 

 
 2. Wall Angels

 Aktiverer de svake musklene mellom skulderbladene.

 
 Stå med ryggen mot veggen, bakhode, skulderblad og korsrygg i kontakt med veggen. Hold armene i 90 graders vinkel ("hendene opp"-posisjon) mot veggen. Skyv armene langsomt opp og ned langs veggen mens du holder kontakten. 3 sett x 10 repetisjoner.
 

 

 
 3. DØrkarm-tøyning for brystmuskulatur

 Tokita et al. (2021) viste at denne tøyningen signifikant Økte brystmuskelens lengde og forbedret skulderposisjon.

 
 Stå i en dØrÅpning med underarmene mot karmene, albuer i skulderhøyde. Ta et lite skritt frem og len brystet gjennom Åpningen til du kjenner strekk foran i skuldrene. Hold 15-30 sekunder, gjenta 3-5 ganger.

How is Vestibular Migraine: When Dizziness Takes Over Your Life diagnosed?

Diagnosis

 

 Barany Society/IHS Diagnostic Criteria:

 For the diagnosis "Definite Vestibular Migraine" the following must be met:

 
 At least 5 episodes with vestibular symptoms of moderate to severe intensity

 Duration from 5 minutes to 72 hours

 Current or past history of migraine (with or without aura)

 At least 50% of attacks must have at least one migraine feature: headache, light/sound sensitivity, or visual aura

 Symptoms cannot be better explained by another diagnosis

 

 Differential Diagnosis:

 
 
 
 Condition
 Duration
 Distinctive Features
 
 
 
 
 Vestibular Migraine
 Minutes to hours
 Migraine features, gradual onset
 
 
 BPPV (Crystal Disease)
 Seconds
 Sudden onset, specific head position
 
 
 Meniere's Disease
 Hours
 Progressive hearing loss, unilateral fullness
 
 
 Vestibular Neuritis
 Days
 Single episode, gradual improvement
 
 
 

 
 Red Flags - See a Doctor or Emergency Room for:

 
 Sudden, intense headache ("the worst headache of my life")

 Headache with fever and neck stiffness

 Unilateral hearing loss or tinnitus

 Double vision or vision loss

 Weakness or numbness in face, arm or leg

 Speech or language difficulties

 Fainting in connection with dizziness

Describe diagnosis for Temporal Arteritis.

Diagnosis

 The diagnosis of temporal arteritis is based on a combination of clinical findings, blood tests, and specialized investigations. Most importantly: Treatment is started on clinical suspicion - you do NOT wait for confirmatory tests. 

 Blood tests

 ESR (erythrocyte sedimentation rate) and CRP

 The ESR is typically significantly elevated, often over 50 mm/h and not infrequently over 100 mm/h. CRP is also elevated. These markers are sensitive but not specific - they can be elevated in many conditions. In rare cases (approximately 5%), ESR and CRP can be normal despite active GCA.

 Specialized investigations

 Temporal artery biopsy (gold standard)

 A small tissue sample from the temporal artery is examined under a microscope. Sensitivity is 80-90% (ACR/EULAR 2022). The biopsy can be falsely negative if the inflammation is patchy (segmental) and the sample is taken from an unaffected area. The biopsy is performed under local anesthesia and is a relatively uncomplicated procedure.

 Ultrasound of the temporal artery

 Color Doppler ultrasound can show a characteristic halo sign - a dark ring around the artery representing edema in the arterial wall (Luqmani et al.). Ultrasound is a non-invasive alternative to biopsy and is quickly available, but requires an experienced examiner.

 ACR/EULAR 2022 classification criteria

 The updated 2022 criteria use a scoring system based on clinical findings, blood tests, and imaging. Important elements include age over 50, new-onset headache, elevated ESR/CRP, temporal artery abnormalities, and positive biopsy or imaging.

 Investigation 
 Role 

 ESR/CRP 
 Screening - ESR typically >50 mm/h, often >100 mm/h 

 Temporal biopsy 
 Gold standard, 80-90% sensitivity 

 Ultrasound (halo sign) 
 Non-invasive alternative, rapid availability 

 PET-CT/MR angiography 
 When large vessel complication is suspected

Describe the five diagnostic criteria (barany society, 2017) for Chronic Dizziness and PPPD.

The Five Diagnostic Criteria (Barany Society, 2017)

 1. Duration

 Dizziness, unsteadiness or non-rotational vertigo present most days for at least three months

 2. Aggravating Factors

 Symptoms worsen with upright posture, active or passive movement, and visually complex or moving stimuli

 3. Triggering Event

 The condition started after an acute vestibular disorder, other medical illness, or psychological stress

 4. Symptom Impact

 Symptoms cause significant distress or functional impairment

 5. No Better Explanation

 Symptoms cannot be better explained by another disease

Describe causes - the hip connection for IT Band Syndrome.

Causes - The Hip Connection

 Research has clearly shown that hip weakness is a major factor in IT band syndrome
 Fredericson's Classic Study (2000)

 Runners with IT band syndrome had 23% weaker hip abductors (women) and 29% weaker (men) compared to
 healthy controls. After 6 weeks of hip strengthening, 92% returned to pain-free running.

 Risk Factors

 Weak hip abductors: Gluteus medius weakness is key

 Rapid training increase: Too much, too soon

 Running on camber: Always the same side of the road

 Downhill running: Increases IT band compression

 Worn shoes: Over 500-800 km

 Knee angle: Maximum irritation at 30 degrees flexion

Describe treatment options for Metatarsalgia.

Treatment

 

 Conservative treatment is very effective for most people with metatarsalgia.

 
 First-Line Treatment

 
 Footwear: Shoes with wide toe box, low heel and good cushioning

 Insoles: Metatarsal pad that offloads the forefoot

 Activity modification: Reduce provoking activities temporarily

 Ice: For swelling or after activity

 
 

 Treatment at Chiropractor

 
 1. Biomechanical Assessment

 Examination of foot biomechanics, gait pattern and possible contributing factors higher up in the
 kinetic chain. Tibialis posterior tendinopathy or ankle instability can affect forefoot loading.

 

 
 2. Manual Treatment

 Mobilization of stiff joints in the forefoot, soft tissue treatment of tight muscles and fascia.

 

 
 3. ExercisesImportant

 Strengthening of intrinsic foot muscles, calf stretching, and balance training.

 

 
 Home Exercise: Toe Spreading

 
 Sit with your foot flat on the floor

 Try to spread your toes apart like a fan

 Hold for 5 seconds, release, repeat

 Do 10-15 repetitions, 2-3 times daily

 
 Tip: This strengthens the small muscles in the foot that help support the forefoot
 arch.

 

 
 When Should You Seek Help?

 
 Pain persists more than 2-3 weeks

 Numbness or burning sensations

 Visible swelling or discoloration

 Pain that wakes you at night

 Difficulty walking normally

Forklar Osteitis Pubis for en pasient.

Osteitis pubis er en ikke-smittsom inflammatorisk tilstand som rammer symphysis pubis - det bruskfylte leddet som forbinder de to skambeina foran i bekkenet. Selv om navnet antyder en benbetennelse, dreier det seg ikke om en infeksjon. Tilstanden representerer snarere en stressreaksjon der repetitiv mekanisk belastning fører til inflammasjon og smerte.

 Forekomsten varierer betydelig mellom ulike grupper. Hos idrettsutovere rapporteres prevalens på 0,5-8% . En studie av 189 utovere med lyskesmerter fant at osteitis pubis var hovedårsaken hos 14%. Blant profesjonelle fotballspillere viser hele 74,8% radiologiske funn forenlig med tilstanden, selv om mange er asymptomatiske.

Explain prognosis - what can you expect? for Pain in Arm, Elbow and Hand.

Prognosis - What Can You Expect?

 Most problems in arm, elbow and hand have a good prognosis with the right approach. 80-90%
 improve significantly , often without the need for surgery. But it takes time - tendons need 3-6
 months to heal properly, and nerve compressions can require patience over several months.

 Key point: Active rehabilitation with specific exercises gives better results than passive treatment alone. Your own effort is crucial for long-term success.

 Honest about relapses

 Many conditions have a risk of relapse if underlying factors aren't addressed. Ergonomics, training
 load and work conditions are often just as important as the treatment itself.

 When should you seek help?

 Pain lasting over 2-3 weeks despite self-treatment

 Symptoms affecting sleep or daily activities

 Uncertainty about what the problems are caused by

 Numbness or tingling that doesn't go away

 Pain that changes rapidly or gets worse

 . As authorised healthcare professionals
 with primary contact status, I can examine and treat you directly - and refer onwards to specialists or
 diagnostic imaging when necessary.

Beskriv årsaker for Occipital nevralgi.

Årsaker

 Occipital nevralgi kan ha mange årsaker, men i mange tilfeller finner man ingen tydelig underliggende årsak (idiopatisk). De vanligste kjente årsakene inkluderer
 Muskelspenninger og triggerpunkter (Vanligst)

 Stramme muskler i øvre nakke kan komprimere occipitalnervene der de passerer gjennom muskulaturen. Særlig semispinalis capitis, trapezius og sternocleidomastoideus. Les mer om triggerpunkter og hodepine .

 Nakkeskader (whiplash)

 Traumer mot nakken kan skade eller irritere occipitalnervene, enten direkte eller gjennom påfølgende muskelspasmer og arrdannelse.

 Artrose i øvre nakkevirvler

 Degenerative forandringer i C1-C3 kan påvirke nervene som danner occipitalnervene. Osteoartritt eller beinsporer kan komprimere nervene.

 Langvarig dårlig holdning

 Fremoverlent hode (f.eks. ved kontorarbeid) kan over tid føre til muskelspenninger og nerveaffeksjon i øvre nakke. Dette kan også bidra til nakkehodepine .

 Andre årsaker

 Betennelse (gikt, diabetes, vaskulitt)

 Infeksjoner

 Svulster (sjelden)

 Komplikasjoner etter nakkekirurgi

Explain treatment for Migraine: Everything You Need to Know.

Treatment

 What Can the Chiropractor Do?

 It is important to be honest about what research shows: The evidence for spinal manipulation treatment for migraine is classified as low to very low certainty according to GRADE criteria (Posadzki et al., Systematic Reviews 2024).

 Important About Evidence

 The best-designed Norwegian study (Chaibi et al., European Journal of Neurology 2017) from Akershus University Hospital found no significant difference between chiropractic treatment and placebo.

 This does not mean manual therapy is without value - many patients experience improvement, but one cannot say for certain whether the effect is due to the treatment itself or other factors.

 Manual treatment may be relevant as part of a holistic approach, especially for patients who
 Prefer non-drug treatment

 Have significant neck stiffness or cervical components ( neck headache )

 Do not tolerate or respond to medications

 Want a multimodal approach combined with lifestyle advice

 What Can You Do Yourself?

 Several self-help strategies actually have stronger evidence than manual treatment
 Lifestyle Measures With Documented Effect

 Regular sleep: Keep fixed bedtimes and wake times, even on weekends. Two-thirds of migraine patients have poor sleep quality

 Regular meals: Don't skip meals - fasting triggers attacks in 57%

 Physical activity: Aerobic exercise reduces attack frequency. At least 30 minutes, 3 times per week has documented preventive effect

 Stable caffeine intake: Sudden withdrawal can trigger attacks. Keep a steady, moderate intake (max 200 mg/day)

 Stress management: Cognitive therapy, relaxation and mindfulness have documented effect

 Supplements

 Magnesium (400-500 mg/day) and riboflavin/vitamin B2 (400 mg/day) have moderate evidence for prevention according to AAN Guidelines (2012). Talk to your doctor before starting.

Hva er prognosen for GTPS - Smerter på Utsiden av Hoften?

Prognose

 

 GTPS er en tilstand som tar tid å behandle - typisk 6-9 måneder for full bedring. Men prognosen er god hvis du er tålmodig og følger et treningsprogram.

 Hva kan du forvente?

 
 Uke 1-4: Smertehandtering og belastningsreduksjon. Mange opplever at det blir verre for det blir bedre.

 Uke 4-12: Gradvis opptrapping av trening. Smertene begynner å avta.

 3-6 måneder: Fortsatt progresjon. De fleste merker tydelig bedring.

 6-12 måneder: Full eller nesten full funksjon. Vedlikeholdstrening anbefales.

Differential diagnoses for Chronic Dizziness and PPPD?

1. Duration

 Dizziness, unsteadiness or non-rotational vertigo present most days for at least three months

2. Aggravating Factors

 Symptoms worsen with upright posture, active or passive movement, and visually complex or moving stimuli

3. Triggering Event

 The condition started after an acute vestibular disorder, other medical illness, or psychological stress

4. Symptom Impact

 Symptoms cause significant distress or functional impairment

5. No Better Explanation

 Symptoms cannot be better explained by another disease

Du er en medisinsk sikkerhetsrådgiver for kiropraktikk. Identifiser røde flagg, gi differensialdiagnostikk og klinisk resonnering. Prioriter alltid pasientsikkerhet. Klassifiser hastegrad: AKUTT (ring 113), HENVIS SAMME DAG, HENVIS RUTINE, MONITORÉR, eller TRYGT.

Vurder røde flagg: 42 år kvinne med kronisk nakkestivhet og spenningshodepine, kommer regelmessig til behandling. I dag nevner hun i forbifarten at hun har hatt en ny type hodepine siste 3 dager — intens, bak venstre øre, annerledes enn vanlig. Ellers føler hun seg fin.

HASTEGRAD: HENVIS SAMME DAG

RØDE FLAGG IDENTIFISERT: Ny type hodepine krever utredning.

Klinisk resonnering:
- "Annerledes enn vanlig" er NØKKELORDET — ny hodepine-type hos kjent hodepine-pasient
- Retroaurikulær lokalisasjon = cervikal arterie-patologi må utelukkes
- Pasienten bagatelliserer ("ellers fin") men disseksjon kan presentere uten dramatiske symptomer initialt
- Selv uten nevrologiske utfall NÅ, kan disseksjon gi slag timer-dager senere

OBS: Fravær av nevrologiske utfall utelukker IKKE disseksjon.

Funn som krever utredning:
- Ny hodepine-type (endret mønster)
- Retroaurikulær lokalisasjon
- Akutt debut (3 dager)

HANDLING: Ikke utfør cervikal behandling i dag. Henvisning til CT-angiografi/MR-angiografi av halskar SAMME DAG. Dokumentér grundig.

Describe most common causes for Foot and Ankle Problems.

Most Common Causes

 Plantar Fasciopathy (Heel Pain)

 10% lifetime risk 

 Go to full article on plantar fasciopathy 

 The most common cause of heel pain. Affects approx. 10% of the population during their lifetime. Most common between 40-60 years. Women have 2.5 times higher risk than men.

 What is it? Degenerative changes in the plantar fascia - the connective tissue band
 that stretches from the heel to the toes. Despite the name "fasciitis", it's not inflammation but
 breakdown of collagen fibres. Therefore the term "fasciopathy" is now used.

 Characteristics: Intense stabbing heel pain with the first steps in the morning
 ("start pain"). The pain often improves after a few minutes, but can return after prolonged activity.

 Most important risk factors
 Limited ankle mobility ( 23x increased risk at zero degrees dorsiflexion)

 Overweight (BMI >30 gives 5-6x increased risk )

 Occupations with lots of standing

 Prognosis: 80-90% improve with conservative treatment within 12 months. Shockwave treatment has the strongest long-term evidence for persistent cases.

 The Heel Spur Myth

 Many think the heel spur "pokes" and causes the pain. This is wrong.

 55% of adults over 60 have heel spurs, but 61% of these have no symptoms 

 Only 31% of people with visible spurs have pain

 Treatment is identical whether there's a spur or not

 Ankle Sprains and Chronic Instability

 19-27 per 1000/year 

 Go to full article on ankle sprains 

 One of the most common musculoskeletal injuries. Annual incidence of 19-27 per 1000 people . 85% affect the lateral (outer) ligaments. Among athletes, the incidence is even higher - up to 11.55 per 1000 training sessions.

 Serious complication: 40% develop chronic ankle instability within 12
 months after first-time sprain if rehabilitation isn't done properly. Among athletes in high-risk
 sports, the numbers are even higher - up to 75% in gymnastics and trampoline.

Describe Medications in the context of Calcific Tendinitis: Everything You Need to Know.

Medications

 NSAIDs (e.g., ibuprofen, diclofenac) can help with pain and inflammation in the acute phase. For
 severe pain, short-term use of stronger painkillers may be necessary.

 

 Surgery

 Surgical removal of the calcium is rarely necessary and is only considered when:

 
 Conservative treatment over 6-12 months provides no improvement

 Symptoms are very disabling

 No signs of spontaneous resorption

 

 
 Conservative treatment success rate

 Studies show that 80-99% of patients recover with conservative treatment. The
 calcium will in most cases be reabsorbed naturally, even if it takes time. Patience is key.
Du er en rask klinisk tekstassistent. Generer korte, presise kliniske oppsummeringer for kiropraktisk dokumentasjon.
Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Hofteartrose: Alt du trenger å vite.

Hva er hofteartrose?: Hofteartrose - også kalt coxartrose eller slitasjegikt i hoften - oppstår når brusken som dekker leddflaten i hoften brytes ned. Brusken fungerer normalt som en glatt pute som lar larbenshodet gli somløst i hofteskalen. Når brusken tynnes, kan det oppstå direkte kontakt mellom bein og bein. Dette gir smerte, stivhet og etter hvert redusert bevegelighet.

Årsaker og risikofaktorer: Risikofaktorene for hofteartrose er godt dokumentert i forskning. Her er de viktigste, rangert etter hvor stor betydning de har
Symptomer: Lyskesmerte er det mest typiske symptomet på hofteartrose og har 84% sensitivitet for å påvise hofteleddsplager (Khan, BMJ, 2004). Smerten kjennes ofte dyp og verkende, på innsiden av læret eller i lyskefolden. Den forverres typisk ved aktivitet som trappegang, lengre gaturer eller å reise seg fra sittende.

Hvordan stilles diagnosen?: Hofteartrose diagnostiseres først og fremst gjennom sykehistorie og klinisk undersøkelse. ACR-kriteriene (American College of Rheumatology) gir 86% sensitivitet og 75% spesifisitet for diagnosen.

Behandling: Manuell behandling kan være et nyttig supplement til trening for hofteartrose, særlig på kort sikt. En systematisk oversikt fra 2012 konkluderte med moderat evidens (Level B) for at kiropraktisk behandling kan gi korttidseffekt (Brantingham, JMPT, 2012).

Prognose - hvordan går det?: Prognosen for hofteartrose er bedre enn mange tror . CHECK-studien, som fulgte 588 pasienter med tidlig hofteartrose i 10 år, fant at bare 12% trengte hofteprotese i løpet av denne perioden. De resterende 88% hadde stabile symptomer og opprettholdt sitt aktivitetsniva.

Patient asks: "Is discogenic pain the same as a herniation?"

No. With a herniation, disc material bulges out and can press on nerve roots, causing leg radiation with numbness or weakness. With discogenic pain, the pain comes from the disc itself without visible bulging or nerve involvement.

Describe The Great Confusion for Sinus Headache or Migraine?.

The Great Confusion

 

 
 
 88%
 have migraine, not sinusitis
 

 
 8 years
 average misdiagnosis time
 

 
 12%
 unnecessarily operated on
 

 

 Similar findings came from the SAMS study in 2007, where only 3% of participants actually had headache from sinusitis. The rest had migraine or other headache types.

 
 Why are they confused?

 The trigeminal nerve supplies both the meninges (where migraine originates) and the sinuses. When migraine activates this nerve, it triggers a reflex causing nasal congestion, watery eyes, and facial pressure - symptoms we associate with a cold or sinusitis.

 Studies show that 40-74% of migraine patients experience at least one such "sinus-like" symptom during attacks.

 

 
 The Critical Difference

 Migraine produces clear fluid from the nose (from nerve activation)

 Bacterial sinusitis produces yellow-green, thick mucus (from infection)

Differential diagnoses for Clicking, Locking and Joint Problems in the Jaw?

1. Clicking (Click)

 A clear, distinct sound - like "clicking" your fingers
 Often happens when opening, but can also occur when closing

 Caused by the disc "jumping" back into place

 Opening click: The disc reduces (returns) when opening

 Closing click: The disc displaces again when closing

 Reciprocal clicking: Click both when opening and closing (most common)

2. Crepitation (Grinding/Scraping)

 A continuous, raspy sound - like sand between fingertips
 May indicate wear in the joint surface (osteoarthritis)

 More common in older people

 Not necessarily painful

 Can be stable over a long time

3. Popping (Sudden Snap)

 Loud, sudden sound - like cracking a finger

 Often caused by cavitation (gas bubble in joint fluid)

 Usually harmless

What is the prognosis for Hip Labral Tear?

Prognosis

 

 The prognosis for labral tear is generally good, especially with early and proper treatment.

 With conservative treatment:

 
 50-80% achieve satisfactory function

 Many return to full activity

 Rehabilitation typically takes 3-6 months

 

 With surgery:

 
 80-90% report improvement

 Full return to sport: 6-12 months

 Good results in younger patients without osteoarthritis

 

 Factors affecting prognosis:

 
 Age - younger patients have better outcomes

 Degree of cartilage damage - more intact cartilage means better prognosis

 Presence of osteoarthritis - reduces success rate

 Motivation for rehabilitation

 

 
 When is prognosis poorer?

 
 Significant osteoarthritis in the hip

 Large cartilage damage

 Long duration of symptoms before treatment

 Age over 50 years

Beskriv ulike typer klikkelyder for Hvorfor klikker skulderen? Årsaker og når du bør bekymre deg.

Ulike typer klikkelyder

 Ikke all klikking er lik. Lyden og følelsen kan gi hint om hva som forårsaker den
 "Pop" eller "klikk"

 En enkeltstående, hørbar lyd - som når du knekker fingrene

 Dette er ofte gassbobler som frigjøres i leddet (kavitasjon). Helt ufarlig og naturlig. Du vil typisk ikke kunne gjenskape lyden umiddelbart etterpå.

 "Knas" eller "knitring"

 En mer knirkende, gjentakende lyd ved bevegelse

 Kan skyldes sener som glir over beinete strukturer, slimposeirritasjon, eller i noen tilfeller tidlige artroseforandringer. Ofte ufarlig, men verdt å observere.

 "Klunk" eller "hopp"

 En følelse av at noe "hopper" eller flytter seg

 Ofte en sene (f.eks. bicepssenen) som hopper over et beinete fremspring. Kan forekomme ved visse bevegelser og er vanligvis ufarlig.

 "Skraping" eller "gnissing"

 En ru, skrapende følelse/lyd ved bevegelse

 Kan indikere bruskforandringer eller artrose. Mer relevant å undersøke, særlig hvis det følges av stivhet eller smerte.

Forklar behandling for Kronisk Svimmelhet og PPPD.

Behandling

 Behandlingen hviler på tre pilarer. Nyere forskning viser at kombinasjonen gir best resultat.

 1. Vestibulær rehabilitering (VRT) - hjørnesteinen

 En fersk meta-analyse fra 2025 (Li et al., Frontiers in Neurology) viste betydelig bedring: DHI-total forbedret seg med 21,84 poeng.

 Blikkstabiliseringsøvelser: Lærer hjernen å stole på vestibulære signaler igjen

 Tilvenningsøvelser (habituering): Gradvis, gjentatt eksponering for bevegelser som provoserer symptomer

 Balansetrening: Utfordrer balansesystemet for å redusere overkontroll

 Visuell desensibilisering: Gradvis eksponering for visuelt "brøkete" miljøer

 Tidsperspektiv: Forbedring starter ofte etter 6-8 uker. Maksimal effekt kan kreve 3-6 måneder.

 2. Kognitiv atferdsterapi (CBT)

 Fordi frykt-unngåelses-adferden er en del av mekanismen som holder PPPD ved like, er det ofte verdifullt å jobbe med tankemønstrene. En meta-analyse fra 2024 viste at CBT kombinert med annen behandling gir signifikant bedre resultater.

 3. Medikamentell behandling (SSRI/SNRI)

 Antidepressiva av typen SSRI eller SNRI brukes ved PPPD - ikke primært mot depresjon, men fordi de stabiliserer nervesystemet. En studie fra 2025 viste vedvarende bedring over 3 år.

Patient asks: "What is the difference between active and latent trigger points?"

Active trigger points cause spontaneous pain and reproduce the pain the patient recognises - these are the primary treatment target. Latent trigger points do not hurt on their own, but are tender when pressed. They can become active through overuse, stress or injury.

Beskriv PronatØrer får færre skader for Overpronasjon: Myte eller medisinsk faktum?.

PronatØrer får færre skader

 

 I 2013 publiserte Nielsen og kolleger en studie i British Journal of Sports Medicine som snudde overpronasjon-myten på hodet.

 
 
 972
 nybegynnerløpere
 

 
 1 ar
 oppfølgingstid
 

 
 Færre
 skader hos pronatØrer
 

 

 Alle deltakerne fikk identiske nøytrale løpesko, uavhengig av fottype. Etter ett Ør med oppfølging viste resultatene:

 
 Studiens funn

 Løpere med pronerte fotter hadde FåRRE skader enn de med nøytral fot.

 Dette er det motsatte av hva overpronasjon-teorien forutsier. Studien konkluderte: Foot pronation is not associated with increased injury risk in novice runners.

 

 Hvorfor? En mulig forklaring er at pronasjon faktisk er kroppens naturlige støtdempingsmekanisme, og at å begrense denne bevegelsen kan Øke belastningen på andre strukturer.

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Hekseskudd.

Hva er hekseskudd?: Hekseskudd er en folkelig betegnelse på akutte ryggsmerter lokalisert til korsryggen (lumbalområdet). Medisinsk kalles det ofte akutt lumbago. Smerten oppstår typisk plutselig, ofte i forbindelse med en bevegelse som løfting, vridning eller boying, men kan også komme uten tydelig utløsende årsak.

Årsaker til hekseskudd: I de fleste tilfeller (ca. 90%) er hekseskudd det man kaller uspesifikke korsryggsmerter. Det betyr at smertene ikke kan tilskrives en spesifikk patologisk årsak som kan påvises på billeddiagnostikk.

Symptomer på hekseskudd: Symptomene ved hekseskudd er typisk lokalisert til korsryggen og kan variere i intensitet
Diagnostikk: Diagnosen hekseskudd stilles primært gjennom sykehistorie og klinisk undersøkelse. Bildediagnostikk er som regel ikke nødvendig ved ukompliserte tilfeller.

Behandling av hekseskudd: Behandlingen av hekseskudd fokuserer på smertelindring, gjenoppretting av funksjon og forebygging av tilbakefall. Forskning støtter en aktiv tilnærming fremfor passiv hvile.

Røde flagg - Når du må søke lege: Selv om hekseskudd vanligvis er en godartet tilstand, finnes det varselsignaler som krever rask medisinsk vurdering. Les mer om røde flagg her .

Prognose og forløpet: Den gode nyheten er at hekseskudd har svært god prognose for de aller fleste
Forebygging: Selv om akutte episoder ikke alltid kan forhindres, er det mye du kan gjøre for å redusere risikoen
Skriv henvisningsbrev til MR lumbal for pasient med vedvarende ischias.

HENVISNING TIL MR LUMBAL COLUMNA

Pasientopplysninger: [Fyll inn]

Henvisende behandler: [Navn], kiropraktor
Dato: [Dato]

Problemstilling:
Vedvarende lumboischialgi høyre side med radikulære symptomer i L5-dermatom.

Anamnese:
Pasienten har hatt tiltagende korsryggsmerte med utstråling til høyre bein i 8 uker. Smerten stråler fra korsrygg, over glutealt, posterolateralt lår, lateralt legg til dorsalside fot. VAS rygg 5/10, ben 7/10. Forverres ved sitting, hosting, nysing. Prøvd konservativ behandling (kiropraktikk, øvelser, NSAID) i 6 uker uten tilfredsstillende bedring.

Kliniske funn:
- SLR positiv 40° høyre (utstrålende smerte i L5-dermatom)
- Krysset SLR svak positiv
- Nedsatt kraft dorsalfleksjon stortå høyre (4/5)
- Redusert sensibilitet lateralt legg/fotrygg høyre
- Reflekser: Achilles 2+ bilateral, Patella 2+ bilateral

Spørsmålsstilling:
Ber om MR lumbalcolumna for å vurdere diskusprolaps/foraminal stenose L4/L5 eller L5/S1 høyre side. Kliniske funn tyder på L5-radikulopati.

Hastegrad: Haster (innen 2 uker) - vedvarende nevrologiske utfall med manglende bedring konservativ behandling.

Patient asks: "What is the difference between overtraining syndrome and REDs?"

OTS is caused by an imbalance between training load and recovery. REDs is caused by energy deficit – you are not eating enough relative to your expenditure. They overlap significantly and can occur simultaneously. Both cause performance decline, hormonal disruption, and increased injury risk. A thorough evaluation should consider both conditions in parallel.

Patient asks: "Can a chiropractor treat tight hip flexors?"

Yes. We use soft tissue treatment, dry needling, mobilisation and muscle relaxation techniques to improve length and function. However, treatment is always combined with exercises -- manual therapy alone rarely produces lasting results.

Hvordan diagnostiseres SLAP-lesjon: Alt du trenger å vite?

Diagnostikk

 

 Diagnosen SLAP-lesjon er utfordrende og krever ofte en kombinasjon av kliniske funn og bildediagnostikk.

 Kliniske tester

 Flere tester er beskrevet, men ingen har høy nok noyaktighet alene:

 
 O'Brien's test (Active compression): Mest brukte, men moderat sensitivitet

 Biceps load test: Positiv ved utadrotasjon mot motstand

 Anterior slide test

 Crank test

 

 
 Testenes begrensninger

 En metaanalyse viste at selv de beste kliniske testene har begrenset noyaktighet. Kombinasjon av flere positive tester Økersannsynligheten, men diagnosen kan sjelden stilles klinisk alene.

 

 Bildediagnostikk

 
 MR artrografi (gullstandard)

 MR med kontrast injisert i leddet. Gir best visualisering av labrum og kan skille mellom ulike typer SLAP-lesjoner. Sensitivitet rundt 80-90%.

 

 
 Vanlig MR

 Kan påvirke SLAP-lesjoner, men har lavere sensitivitet enn MR artrografi. Nyttig for å se etter samtidig patologi (rotatormansjett, etc.).

 

 
 Viktige forbehold

 
 Selv MR artrografi har falsk-positive funn

 SLAP-forandringer er vanlige hos asymptomatiske

 MR-funn må alltid korreleres med klinikken

 Alder over 40 Ør: Type I-forandringer er ofte normalfunn

Provide a structured clinical overview of Muscle Pain vs. Nerve Pain.

Why Is It Important to Distinguish Between Them?: Many patients come to the clinic describing their pain as "sciatica" or "muscle tension" - but the reality is often more nuanced. Understanding whether pain primarily comes from muscles or nerves is critical because
Muscle Pain (Myalgia) - Characteristics: Trigger points deserve special attention because they can cause referred pain that resembles nerve pain
Self-Tests You Can Try at Home: Interpretation: If you get pain/tingling down the leg that eases when you lift your head, it indicates nerve irritation.

When Both Are Present: Often patients have elements of both pain types
Red Flags - Seek Help Quickly: See a doctor or emergency room if you experience
Prognosis: Generally good prognosis. Most trigger points and muscle tension respond well to treatment within 2-6 weeks. Chronic cases may take longer, but improvement is expected with the right approach.

Frequently Asked Questions: Yes! Trigger points in gluteal muscles can cause referred pain radiating all the way to the calf, easily confused with sciatica. The difference is that muscle-referred pain doesn't follow a specific dermatomal pattern and rarely causes numbness or weakness.

Patient asks: "Does cortisone help?"

Short-term yes, long-term doubtful. For GTPS, the LEAP study showed that
 cortisone gave rapid improvement in the first weeks, but after 1 year the results were no better than
 doing nothing. Systematic reviews have also shown potential negative effects on tendon tissue over
 time. I usually recommend trying exercise first.

Patient asks: "What is popliteus syndrome?"

You are a clinical documentation specialist for chiropractic. Generate accurate, professional patient explanations using correct medical terminology.
Explain prognosis and rehabilitation for Cervical Myelopathy.

Prognosis and rehabilitation

 The prognosis for cervical myelopathy depends largely on when treatment begins and the severity at the time of diagnosis .

 After surgery

 60-80% 
 experience functional improvement 

 Better 
 prognosis with early intervention 

 NORspine 
 records Norwegian outcomes 

 AO Spine data (Fehlings et al. 2017) shows that 60-80% of surgically treated patients experience improvement in function. Factors affecting the outcome
 Duration of symptoms: Shorter history gives better results

 Severity at surgery: Milder myelopathy gives better outcomes

 Age: Younger patients generally recover better

 MRI findings: Absence of T1 signal changes is favorable

 Comorbidity: Diabetes and other conditions can affect healing

 NORspine registry

 In Norway, outcomes from spinal surgery are recorded in the NORspine registry. This provides valuable information about treatment results at a national level and contributes to quality improvement. Your surgeon can provide information about results from their own hospital.

 Rehabilitation

 After surgery, rehabilitation is important to optimize the outcome
 Early mobilization: Most patients can begin gentle activity shortly after surgery

 Physiotherapy: Structured exercise program for strength and mobility

 Gait training: For persistent balance and walking difficulties

 Ergonomic adaptation: Workplace accommodations

 Long-term follow-up: Regular check-ups to detect degeneration at adjacent levels

 Be honest about expectations

 Surgery can halt progression and lead to improvement, but complete restoration to normal function is not always possible — especially in severe and long-standing myelopathy. Realistic expectations and patience during the rehabilitation phase are important.

Identify red flags for L4.

Red Flags - When should you see a doctor immediately?

 URGENT - Seek emergency care for
 Cauda equina syndrome: Saddle numbness, bladder/bowel problems, progressive bilateral weakness

 Acute foot drop: Cannot lift foot/toes - requires rapid evaluation

 Progressive weakness: Noticeable worsening of strength over days

 Cauda equina syndrome is a rare but serious condition where the nerve bundle at the bottom of the spinal cord is compressed. It affects approximately 1 in 65,000 people annually, but requires immediate surgical treatment to prevent permanent damage.

Patient asks: "Is fibromyalgia the same as rheumatism?"

No. Rheumatic diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis involve inflammation of joints and tissues. Fibromyalgia is not an inflammatory disease — it involves altered pain processing in the nervous system. However, the two conditions can co-occur.

Explain treatment of headache for Headaches and Migraines.

4 Treatment of Headache

 Chiropractic Treatment

 Chiropractic care has documented effect for cervicogenic headache and tension headache with muscular component. A systematic review and meta-analysis showed moderate evidence for spinal manipulation in neck headache.

 What I Do

 Thorough examination of neck, jaw and shoulder

 Joint mobilization and correction of upper cervical vertebrae

 Soft tissue treatment of trigger points and tight muscles

 Exercises for neck and posture

 Ergonomic advice and preventive strategies

 Medical Treatment of Migraine

 Migraine often requires medical treatment from a doctor or neurologist.

 Acute treatment: Triptans (like sumatriptan) are standard treatment for moderate to severe attacks

 Preventive: Beta-blockers, candesartan, topiramate, amitriptyline

 For chronic migraine: Botox or CGRP inhibitors

Clinical summary of Subluxation: Old Theory vs Modern Understanding.

Key takeaways

 Chiropractic has evolved from a philosophical theory about subluxations to a modern, evidence-based profession

 The subluxation theory fails Hill's epidemiological criteria for causation (Mirtz et al., 2009)

 Manipulation works through neurophysiological mechanisms, not by putting vertebrae back in place (Pickar, 2002; Bialosky et al., 2009)

 Norwegian chiropractic is university-based and evidence-based -- subluxation is not used as a clinical diagnosis

Clinical summary of Lumbar Foraminal Stenosis.

Key Takeaways

 What it is: Narrowing of the nerve opening (foramen) where the nerve root exits the spine, most commonly in the lower back

 Common causes: Age-related degeneration, disc bulging, facet joint hypertrophy, osteophytes

 Chiropractic treatment: Flexion-based mobilization, exercise and ergonomic guidance - conservative treatment is first choice

 Red flags: Increasing weakness in legs, loss of bladder/bowel control - call 113 or emergency services 

 Consultation: 45 min initial visit, 30 min follow-up

You are a clinical documentation assistant for chiropractors. Generate professional medical documentation.
Describe Why Compensation Leads to Injury for How a Stiff Back Ruins Your Golf Swing and Tennis Serve.

Why Compensation Leads to Injury

 

 The body is remarkably good at finding detours when the main road is blocked. The problem is that these
 detours often have lower capacity and higher "tolls." With prolonged thoracic pain, the musculature between the shoulder blades can become overloaded.

 A study by Wasser and colleagues (2018) analyzed 187 baseball pitchers and found that college pitchers on
 average had -25 degrees of lumbar extension (backward bend in the lower back) at maximum arm rotation.
 Most pitchers spent 45% of the pitch with more than 30 degrees of lumbar extension.

 
 
 27.6%
 Baseball pitchers with pars defects
 

 
 3-7%
 Prevalence in general population
 

 

 Specifically among baseball pitchers, Wasser et al. (2018) found a spondylolysis (stress fracture in the pars) prevalence of approximately 27%. In the general athletic population, the prevalence is estimated at 8-15%.
 

 
 The Mechanism Summarized

 Kim et al. (2016) summarized the mechanism clearly: "Excessive movements in the lumbar spine
 are due to limited movements in the thoracic vertebrae." When the thoracic spine doesn't
 rotate sufficiently, the lower back must take over - and it isn't built for the job.
